She has turned to Ceprodel for financial support in order to purchase more stock. She hopes to receive support as soon as possible to invest in her business and continue with her successful venture.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Sandra H. es una dama cuya labor es el negocio de pulpería atendido en el municipio de Somotllo de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. Hace siete años decidió invertir en la compra de productos para comercializarlos y al ver que los vendía poco a poco fue incrementando sus productos hasta llegar a establecer su pulpería y ubicarla en su casa de habitación.

Sus dos hijos se sienten muy orgullosos de ella porque ha logrado proporcionarles todo lo necesario para sus estudios y además les ha proporcionado el alimento para su desarrollo.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel con el objetivo de ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual le sea proporcionado para la adquisición de su mercadería. Por este motivo ella espera recibir su crédito para invertir lo mas pronto posible en el negocio y así continuar con el mantenimiento de los suyos.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Don Cristóbal is 57 years old. He is married and works as a labourer buying and selling bananas. His business is located at his home in the Caserío Pajocá, in the village of Pacamaché, Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, in Sololá department. Because of his constant efforts to get ahead, he managed to obtain a small banana business. His positive attitude in the community means he is a well-known and well-liked businessman in Caserío Pajocá.

In the past he was a labourer doing work in the countryside for various people; he used to work on farms in order to earn money for his family. Thanks to his hard work, he managed to buy several plots of land growing bananas and coffee. As a result of the harvests, he managed to start a small business buying and selling bananas. Because he doesn’t have enough money to continue his business, he went to the ASDIR offices for a loan so that he would be better able to serve his customers and become more a part of the community. In this way he will be able to continue expanding his business and provide his family with better quality of life.

Cristóbal M. E. is known in the community as a responsible and principled person and as a good businessman. He currently has one employee in his banana business, a business that has generated work opportunities and also provided a better standard of living for his employee.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Don Cristóbal tiene actualmente 57 años de edad, es Unido, de oficio Jornalero y que actualmente se dedica al comercio (compra y venta de banano) la cual su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio en el Caserío Pajocá, de la Aldea Pacamaché, Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, departamento de Sololá, gracias a sus esfuerzos día a día para salir adelante logro tener un pequeño negocio de Banano, y su actitud positiva en la comunidad ahora ya es un comerciante muy conocido y querido en la comunidad del Caserío Pajocá, ya que antes era jornalero para realizar trabajos de campo con diferentes personas, viajaba en fincas a ganar dinero para el mantenimiento de su familia, y gracias a esos esfuerzos consiguió comprar varias cuerdas de terreno con cultivos de banano y café, y con sus cosechas que recibe de parte de ellos logro iniciar un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de banano, por tal razón que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para seguir dicho negocio se vio en la necesidad de acudir en las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR, para poder dar una mejor atención a la clientela y así poder identificarse mas con la comunidad y solo así poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia. A don Cristóbal M. E., se le conoce en la comunidad como una persona responsable y de buenos principios como un buen emprendedor del trabajo que realiza, actualmente cuenta con 1 trabajador en su negocio de compra de banano la cual esto ha generado oportunidades de trabajo, como también a que la familia del empleado tenga una mejor condición de vida.

loans.use: Buying and selling bananas

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.ru:
Джаборов Абдулхамид родился 2 февраля 1956 года. Он женат, у него 3 детей. Начал свой бизнес с продажи риса и занимается этим 5 лет. В его ассортимент входят различные виды рисов как «Дев-зира», «Ёва», «Кенджа», сечка. Иногда в его ассортименте можно увидеть бобовые культуры как фасоль и гарох. Ему в торговле помогает сын. Его места торговли центральный рынок города Вахдат а закупает товар в рынке «Шохмансур». В сезон сбора урожая Абдулхамид ездит на рисовые поля чтоб договорится о покупке риса у самих дехкан. В связи с этим он хочет получит займ в сумме 4100 сомони на год. 
На будущее Абдулхамид хочет построить себе магазин и расширить свой ассортимент.
texts.en:
Abdulhamid Djaborov was born on the 2nd of September, 1956. He is married and has 3 children. He has his business of selling rice 5 years ago. He has a large variety of different types of rice for sale. Sometimes he sells beans and peas as well. His son helps him with the business. He purchases goods on the Shohmansur market and sells it on the Vahdat market. When rice is in season, Abdulahmid travels to the rice fields to be able to purchase rice directly. He would like to obtain a 1 year loan of $1200 to stock up on goods boost his business.

In the future he plans to build himself a store and increase the variety of goods he has for sale.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and peas

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam S. is a farmer in the Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her plantation field has infertile soil. So she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to make her field more productive. In addition to farming, she owns a small grocery store in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Hor Khloeun, is a construction worker who makes $2.50 per day, a very small income to support his family. Mrs. Sam S. is 27 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the youngest one is too young for school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam has been selling charcoal and oil in Dodoma, Tanzania for 10 years. She is now seeking her first loan so that she may increase her inventory and purchase the materials in bulk to sell at retail prices in her shop. She currently works 11 hours every day and earns approximately US$ 25 each month. She is hoping to reinvest any increase in profits back into her business so that it can continue to grow.

Mariam is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children. In addition, she cares for four dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Neema, Sabrina, and Mgeni.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and oil to sell

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Groupa

texts.en:
Madinah T., a married woman with five children and the care of two dependent relatives, is an executive member of Tusooka Kwavula group in Lugazi. A long-time owner of a hotel / restaurant business, Madinah has been able to buy more equipment such as sauce pans, plates, spoons, forks, tables and seats for her restaurant through the help of previous loans. She has also been able to include a greater variety of foods on her restaurant menu, something that seemed impossible when she first joined her lending group.

Now requesting another loan to purchase more plates and foodstuffs for her business, Madinah is grateful that through her various meetings with her group members, she has learned to manage her loans with prompt repayments.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs and more plates for her restaurant.

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Hou S., 39 resides with her six children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She makes and sells tofu to the market and is able to make $3 of profit a day.  Her husband, Kong Bun Thoeun, 40, has a business raising fish and owns a grinding mill. On average, he makes $8 a day. Five of their children are students and one is too young to attend the school. Every month, they spend $100 on food, $30 on utilities and $50 on children’s education. 

Hou S. would like to take out a loan of $1200 to purchase rice and beans for her husband. Her husband will use the mill to take off husks from the rice and beans and then resell the crops for profit.

loans.use: To purchase rice and beans to grind

loans.name: Bilquis M. Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Bilquis baji is a 38-year-old married lady and resides in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She has lived in this city for the past 20 years. She married to a person whose name is M. A.. He has a utensil-selling business with an experience of 15 years in this business.

Bilquis baji is the mother of four sons. None of her children goes to school. Bilquis baji helps her husband sell utensils in the community and her husband sells utensils to the other parts of Borewala. She is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s business by buying more utensils.

Bilquis baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a handset for her PCO (Public call office: people come to make phone calls and pay a set rate per minute). Lubna baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. Farida Khanum baji wants a loan to buy eggs for her egg-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy utensils to re-sell

loans.name: Juana Luisa

texts.es:
Juana  es socio del Bancomunal Los Viñedos. 
Juana es casada, tiene 44 años, tres hijos  de 16, 13 y 5 años sus hijos van a la escuela Santo Domingo, los cedros. Juana estudio Ingeniería civil, no termino por que se caso, se dedico a criar sus hijos.   
Siempre le gustaron las manualidades, y viendo la televisión aprendió   hacerlas, decidió tomar unos cursos para perfeccionarse, esta estudiando brocado en cinta y como hacer collares.  
Desde que esta en Finca tiene mas disponibilidad de dinero, aprendió ahorrar y las charlas le han ayudado a como manejar su negocio de manualidades y como sacar la ganancia, la han elegido secretaria del Bancomunal.

Necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para alquilar una tienda, y mantenimiento de sus maquinas de coser.  
El sueño de Juana es tener una tienda propia y vender todas las manualidades que esta haciendo, se ha propuesto alquilar una tienda para este año.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "Los Viñedos" community bank. She is 44 years old, married and has three children aged 16, 13 and 5 who attend the Santo Domingo school in Los Cedros. Juana studied to be a civil engineer but did not graduate because she got married and raised her children. She has always enjoyed making handicrafts and learned to make them by watching television. She decided to take some courses to perfect herself and is now studying how to make brocade ribbons and how to make necklaces. Since joining Finca she has had more money, she has learnt to save money and the talks have helped her learn to manage her handicraft business and make an income from it. She was elected secretary of her community bank. She needs a loan of 800 soles to rent a store and maintain her sewing machines. Juana's dream is to have her own store and sell the crafts she is making. She plans to rent a store this year.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent a store and maintain her sewing machines.

loans.name: Judy

texts.es: Judy tiene 28 años y vive en casa de sus padres. Ella borda fustanes desde hace 2 años, la curiosidad hizo que adquiera esta habilidad de desarrollar arte en sus manos, los acabados que les da a sus obras son su mayor ventaja ya que gusta mucho a sus clientes, siendo una buena fuente de ingresos. Cada día realiza estos trabajos en su casa para después que de un mes aproximadamente, venderlos y entregarlos a las personas que los solicitaron. Para Judy esta forma de trabajo es la ideal, ya que le permite disfrutar día a día del trabajo que realiza; entre sus planes está mejorar su producción y empezar un negocio de venta de animales, lo cual podrá efectuar conjuntamente con los bordados. Es la primera vez que Judy tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para comprar telas e hilos por el valor de 250 soles y con los 250 soles restantes adquirirá animales, como ovejas y así iniciar su negocio de compra venta de animales.
texts.en:
Judy is 28 years old and lives in her parent’s home. She has been embroidering for 2 years. Curiosity inspired her to develop this art with her hands, and the finishing touches she gives her products are her greatest advantage as her customers like her work a lot, and it is therefore a good source of income. Every day she works at home so that approximately one month later she sells and delivers them to the people who have ordered. For Judy this type of work is ideal as it allows her to enjoy, day after day, the work that she does. Among her plans are to improve her production and begin an animal business, which she will do along with her embroidery. This is the first time that Judy has a loan with MFP, and she promises to be one of the most active members of her communal bank. The money she seeks will be used to buy fabric and thread valued at 250 soles and with the other 250 soles she will acquire animals such as sheep and in this way begin her business buying and selling animals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her embroidery business

loans.name: Mamavi

texts.fr:
Mme Mamavi A. est marié et mère de deux (02) enfants. Agée de trente cinq (35) ans, elle s’est vite lancée dans la vente des produits de premières nécessités (riz, huiles, savons et autres). 
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de son activité et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices, elle sollicite un financement. Ce financement lui permettra de satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. Mamavi A. is married and the mother of two children. She is 35 years old and got started immediately in selling essential goods (rice, oils, soaps, and more). Concerned about expanding her business and increasing her sales figures and profits, she's requesting financing, which will enable her to satisfy the ever-growing demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell basic goods

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom P. lives in Kampong Svay village, in Kandal province. She is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Seng Long, owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from the plantation, he is a fisherman.

Although they work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their household. In order to improve their lives, Mom decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She will use the rest of money to buy a machine to use with her husband's boat.

She is a 36 year-old mother of two children; one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: Buy a cow for breeding and a machine to use with her husband’s fishing boat.

loans.name: Azizullah

texts.en:
Azizullah is the son of Y. M.. He lives in district 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 39 and married. He lives in a family with 6 members, including his father and mother.

He needed to repair his house, but it was not possible for him because with the monthly salary he receives he can only pay for household expenses. When he heard about the loan process he decided to take out a loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 6 months to buy all the needed construction materials. He is grateful for this process.

loans.use: buying construction materials

loans.name: Eva Maria

texts.es: La señora Eva Maria G., tiene la edad de 25 años, habita en el barrio esquipulas, ubicado en km11 ½ carretera Masaya, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como taxista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su hogar es poder formar una familia y agrandar mas su negocio;  ella desde hace seis años tiene una panadería y repostería, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento para poder invertir en su inventario y abastecer a todo su clientes .Con el financiamiento obtenido lo va invertir en compra varias como: harina, azúcar, chocolate y todo lo que sea para hacer sus queques, da las gracias a la institución de Afodenic por el apoyo que ha tenido, lo cual se ha beneficiado para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eva María G. is 25 years old. She lives in the Esquipulas neighborhood, located at kilometer 11 ½ on the highway to Masaya, with her husband, who works as a taxi driver to help out with the household expenses. Their plans for their home are to have children and to expand their business. Eva María has had a bakery and cake decorating business for six years. The biggest difficulty she has is the lack of financing she needs to be able to invest in inventory and supply all of her clients. With this loan, she will invest in buying: flour, sugar, chocolate, and everything she needs for her cakes. She is grateful to the Afodenic institution for the support she has had, which has benefited her in the growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients she needs to make her cakes.

loans.name: Садриддин

texts.ru: Садриддину исполнилось 29 лет, женат и имеет 2 детей. После окончания школы не нашел постоянной работы и поэтому он выехал в Россию на заработки. Проработав несколько лет он приехал на родину и купил здесь машину, на которой стал заниматься частными перевозками – такси. Основной доход семьи у него от этого вида деятельности. Кроме этого занимается куплей продажей скота на местных рынках. Также у него дома несколько голов скота за которыми смотрит его жена. Садриддин подал заявку на займ КИВА и собирается увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Sadriddin turned 29 years old; he is married and has 2 children. After finishing school he did not find permanent employment and because of this traveled to Russia to earn money. Having worked for several years he returned to the motherland and bought a car here, on which he provides private transport – a taxi. The family’s main income is this business. In addition, he also purchases and sells livestock at the local markets. Also, he has several heads of livestock at home, which are taken care of by his wife. Sadriddin applied for a loan on KIVA and plans to increase his livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Jethro

texts.en: Paglaum MPC was created to give programs and services to those who are in need of financial assistance and to provide training with regard to business. Jethro O. became a member of Paglaum in July of 2008. Jethro lacked financial capital for his sari-sari store. (The word sari-sari is Tagalog for "various kinds".)  Jethro had only enough money to build the variety store. He is requesting PHP 20,000 to buy additional goods for sale. He is thankful that he now has income for his family. In the future, Jethro hopes to expand his business to a mini-grocery store and for his family to have a house of their own.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou B. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle souhaite renforcer son activité d’embauche bovine et ovine. Son objectif est de subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Kadiatou B., age 42, is married and the mother of 3 children. She would like to bolster her business consisting in raising cattle and sheep. Her goal is to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise cattle and sheep

loans.name: Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:   Gloria del Carmen R. V., Carmen A. M. y Pabla María T..

El grupo solidario está compuesto de tres mujeres originarias de la zona norte del país, tienen nueve años de vivir en la ciudad de Masaya.
Doña Gloria del Carmen es la coordinadora del grupo, es una joven mujer, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el M. de Masaya, ella trabaja desde muy joven , este oficio lo aprendió de su madre que vende a la par de ella.
Sueña con mejorar su casa y hacer un ahorro para cuando sea una adulta mayor  y así no depender de su hijo y además engrandecer su negocio.

 Doña Carmen A. ella vende verduras y frutas en el M. de Masaya, su horario de trabajo es desde temprana horas de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde que regresa a su casa, ella ofrece principalmente plátanos que compra al mayor en el mismo M. y ella vende al detalle.En su casa vende refrescos y golosinas, sus hijos le ayudan a ver el negocio, tiene dos hijos en edad de 11y 8 años.Espera poder crecer en su negocio para alcanzar sus metas de mejorar su vivienda.


Doña Pabla María T. es una joven soltera que trabaja elaborando tortillas en su casa,tiene buena clientela, trabaja diariamente desde tempranas horas hasta el medio día que lo dedica a la compra de los insumos en el M.. El crédito lo necesita para comprar maíz , leña, comales, etc.

Expresan que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que reciben y también a mejorar de manera personal.Se proponen trabajar con Adim en varios ciclos y están claras que para esto es solamente si son disciplinadas en sus pagos.
texts.en:
From left to right in the photograph; Gloria del Carmen R. V., Carmen A. M. and Pabla María T.. This solidarity group is comprised of three woman who are from the north originally, but have lived in the city of Masaya for nine years. Doña Gloria del Carmen is the group’s coordinator. She is a young woman who has two children and lives with her husband. She sells fruit and vegetables for a living in Masaya’s market. Doña Gloria del Carmen has been working since she was a young girl. In fact, she learned this job from her mother who sells along side her. She would love to be able to fix up her house and save some money so that when she is older she won’t have to depend on her son. She would also like to grow her business. Doña Carmen A. sells fruits and vegetables in Masaya’s market. She works from early in the morning and goes home at three in the afternoon. She mainly sells plantains at retail prices that she buys wholesale in the same market. She also sells soft drinks and sweets from her home. Her kids, who are 11 and 8, help her take care of the business. She hopes to grow her business so she can achieve her goals and make improvements to her home. Mrs. Pabla María T. is a young woman who is single. She makes tortillas at home and has many customers. She works everyday from early in the morning until mid-day when she goes to the market to buy her supplies. She needs a loan to buy corn, firewood, and “comales” (a pan to fry tortillas in). They say that ADIM has taught them how to manage their business better and also grow on a personal level through the trainings they receive. They plan to continue working with ADIM for several cycles and understand that they can only do this if they are disciplined about making their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es: Alba Nubia R. M. tiene 28 años. Es una hombre casado tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella es una mujer muy alegre. Alba se dedica a la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque anteriormente su Mama se dedicaba a la venta de ropa. Actualmente es Alba quien se hace cargo de negocio ya que tenía que ofrecerles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación, y como no tenía un trabajo estable decide quedarse con el negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, shorts y chaquetas. Su deseo es establecer un negocio.
texts.en:
Alba Nubia R. M. is 28 years old, married, and has 2 dependent children. She is a happy woman who has been selling clothes for more than 5 years. Alba became involved in this line of work because her mother was also a clothing vendor. Now that she is charge of the business, Alba is able to educate and feed her children because she did not have a stable job before.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts and jackets. She hopes that her business becomes well established.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For porgress business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-five years old. She is single and has no child. She lives with her parents in a family house in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Beatrice is a trader. She trades in printed textiles – fancy, java and wax prints and lace materials. She hawks (goes door to door) to sell in her community and treks to other towns to sell as well. She procures her goods from textile depots in Kumasi.

Beatrice has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is 36years old she is married and mother of three children. All her children are in school in the community where they live. She is very hard working women and works to support the husband in taking care of the family. She trades in Ghana made slippers; she takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She purchases them in different sizes, colors and designs so that her customers can make their choice. She mostly sells them through hawking that is house to house selling. She has no regret of this business because it has given her lots of experienced in marketing and sales. And this business also brings income to support her family. She requests for your loan assistance to buy stock in bulk. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy Ghana made slippers in Kumasi for retail.

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Mrs. Thong S., 53, is a local grocery seller who has been operating in this sector at the market for more than three years. She has a daughter who appears in the picture, assists with her in selling inventory. Thong S. sells her items like cooking ingredient, plastic good, cane good, and other soft drinks, and is typically able to earn around of US$10 a current day. Recently, a part of her good has been sold out to customer; Thong S. wants to restock and is requesting a loan from HKL to accumulate a larger quantities of grocery inventory to greatly sell.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantities of grocery inventory to greatly sell

loans.name: Las Canelas Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Panamericana” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Las Canelas”, con 10 integrantes, se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo, en su mayoría se dedican al tejido artesanal de mantas y otras prendas , es el caso de Martina C. de 39 años, casada y madre de 6 niños, ella teje mantas hace un año, muchos de sus productos lo vende en la feria 16 de Julio ambulando (ofreciendo de puerta a puerta sus productos) y necesita el préstamo para comprar lana. Martina la igual que sus compañeras espera estar mucho tiempo con la familia de Pro Mujer y hacer uso del consultorio, sobre todo para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Asociación Comunal “Las Canelas” is part of “Panamericana”, one of the Focal Centers of Pro Mujer. It is made up for 10 members who mostly work in the weaving of blankets and other artesan items. Martina C. is 39 years old, married and mother of 6 children. She has been weaving blankets for a year now, and she mostly sells her goods in the traveling fair 16 de Julio (selling her goods door to door). She needs the loan to purchase wool. Martina, as well as the other women in the group, expect to be part of the Pro Mujer family for a long time and take advantage of the clinic services, especially for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of wool

loans.name: Juana De Jesús

texts.es: Juana De Jesús R. de 45 Años de edad, reside en  Concepción en el departamento de La Unión. Hace 20 años el esposo de Juana murió quedándose desabrigada y con sus dos hijos que en aquellos años eran unos bebes, ahora soy el orgullo de Juana por ser unas personas honradas y responsables su hijo mayor es Carlos de 24 años de edad está a unos meses de graduarse de la universidad y su hija Clara de 22 años de estudiante universitaria también. Juana ha luchado mucho para salir adelante siempre dedicándose al comercio, actualmente posee una venta de hamburguesas y hotdog a las afueras de su casa,  ella esta solicitando de este crédito para poder ampliar sus ventas con mayor  variedad de antojitos para comercializar.
texts.en:
Juana De Jesús R. is 45 years ago and lives in Concepción in the department of La Unión. Twenty years ago, Juana was left without any support when her husband passed away while her two children were still babies. Today she is proud that her children are honorable and responsible people. Her son Carlos is 24 years old and months away from graduating from university. Her daughter Clara is 22 years old and also a university student.

Juana has fought hard to get ahead and has always been dedicated to her business. She currently sells hamburgers and hot dogs in front of her house. She is requesting a loan so that she can increase her sales and offer a wider variety of snacks to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This entrepreneur is 25 years old, single, and has a primary school education. He has been working in this market for five years. Despite his youth he has a good reputation in the market and also he is an employee in a government office. His brother collaborates with him in his work.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and to redesign his market

loans.name: Mirella Del Carmen

texts.es: Mirella del Carmen L. D. C. D. 32 años, resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores D. edad. Mirella posee una sala D. belleza y una barbería la cual la atienden junto a su esposo, ella se encarga D. realizar el trabaja a las clientas y su esposo se encarga D. realizar el trabajo a los clientes masculinos.  Mirella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos para el cabello como tintes y tratamientos, todo D. primera calidad, con el fin D. poder brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, D. manera que estos sean clientes fieles a ella. Mirella trabaja en conjunto junto a su esposo por el bienestar D. su familia, ya que este negocio es su única fuente D. ingresos que ellos poseen, es por ello que su mayor deseo es surtir el salón D. belleza, D. manera que puedan incrementa sus márgenes D. ganancias, que es lo primordial para brindarles una vida estable a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirella del Carmen L. D. C. is 32 years old and lives in the department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her husband and her two young children. Mirella owns a beauty salon and barbershop where she works alongsiD. of her husband. She works with the female clients while her husband works with the men.

Mirella is asking for a loan to buy good quality hair products like hair dye and hair treatments. With these products, she and her her husband will be able to offer a better service to their clients and in turn their clients will remain loyal to them.

Mirella and her husband work for the wellbeing of their family. This business is their only source of income, which is why her greatest desire is to supply the beauty salon so that they can increase their income margin. Increasing their earnings is paramount to providing a stable life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair products

loans.name: María

texts.es: María L. T., reside en Colón departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija la cual trabaja para sus propios gastos. María L. se dedica a coser ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, realiza su trabajo desde su propia casa y cuenta con muy buenas referencias por ser una persona que realiza su trabajo lo mejor posible, así mismo porque entre las prendas de vestir a tiempo y cose a muy buenos precios. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar hilo, telas y repuestos  para su máquina de coser. María desea poder seguir adelante con su negocio, ya que es este el que le permite poder solventar todas sus necesidades, así mismo es a través de este como pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María L. T. lives in Colón, in the region of La Libertad, with her husband and their daughter, who is employed. María works as a tailor; she sews clothing for men, women and children. María works from her home and because she works quickly and does good work for a good price, she gets plenty of referrals. She has asked for a loan so that she can buy thread, fabric and parts for her sewing machine. María wants nothing more than to continue her work, and this loan will allow her to meet some of her business needs and also help her provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying thread, fabric and sewing machine parts

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora ZULMA, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos, (18, 12, 10, 6) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con  la compra y venta desde hace 5 años de cosméticos de belleza para damas y artículos para caballeros, nuestra socia vende por catálogos sus productos, en está ocasión la socia solicita el préstamo para poder apoyar a su esposo con la compra de una maquinaria de soldadura, el esposo tiene un taller y están comprando poco a poco las diferentes herramientas de trabajo. 

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Zulma belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas." She is a native of the city of Cusco. She is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 18, 12, 10 and 6. Zulma alternates her activities in the home with the purchase and sale of beauty products and cosmetics for women and items for men; she has had this business for 5 years. She sells her products through catalogs. At this time she requests a loan so that she can help her husband with the purchase of a welding machine. Her husband has a workshop, and little by little, he is acquiring various tools for his work. Zulma is grateful, and expresses her satisfaction in being able to continue growing her own business. She pledges to make the payments on her debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she requests a loan to help her husband buy machinery for his welding workshop

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 47 years old and married to Perpeto. They have four children, and their oldest child is now 22 years old. Perlita began farming in 2005, and she continues to grow rice for a living. Her 1.5-hectare rice field provides income for her family. She wants to double her harvest to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP. She wants this loan in order to properly invest in her farm. With this amount, she will be able to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Sourng

texts.en:
Sourng S. is 37 years old and married and resides with her husband in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two school-aged children and stays at home as a housewife to look after the children and the household chores. Her husband operates his motorbike with a compartment attached as a tuk-tuk driver, earning an income of $7 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has been improved since he started this business, so they want to have a loan to expand it.

S. is requesting a loan of $700 to build rental rooms for the garment factory workers. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

(S. was not available so her husband is pictured above instead.)

loans.use: To build rental rooms for garment factory workers.

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en:
B. Otabek is 24 years old and married. For the past two years, he has owned a shop from which he sells spare moped engine parts. The income he earns allows him to support his family, including his parents. To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Otabek would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from increased sales will allow him to continue to improve his living conditions. This loan will greatly improve Otabek’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku M. sells bags of sugar, cooking oil, etc. at the market and is requesting a loan to buy bags of rice, pulses (such as lentils), and beans to sell.  She is 30 years old and married to a chief. They have three children in school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a department store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase bags of rice, beans, etc. to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
N. Catherine is thirty-five years old and has a clothing business situated at Kalerwe. She has been operating her business for over four years.

Catherine is using the loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Purposely the loan is increasing her working capital as well as improving her stock.

Catherine is an encouraging business woman whose dream is to own a big clothing shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the town of Brgy.Uno, Katipunan. She is 45 years old, married and has 1 adult-aged child. Evelyn owns and operates a business making and selling food such as viands, fruits, and other grocery products in the local community. Evelyn has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan, her 9th, of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional working capital for her mini-carenderia (food stall). She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 50 years old and she is married.  Marthe has a shop where she sells various women's shoes.  She has been in this business for about two years and her shop is open from 7 am to 8 pm every day.

Marthe is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to add more items for sale mainly shoes for men as well as shoes for children. In addition, she will upgrade her facilities.  With the use of this loan, Marthe is expecting to earn more profits which will be used for reinvestment in her business as well as keeping up the sustainability of her business.

loans.use: Additional styles of shoes for sale

loans.name: Chok

texts.en:
Chok O., 30, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells groceries for an income of about USD 1.2 per day.

Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.

O. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou D. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 06 en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG AÏDARA dont elle est la trésorière depuis  le 28 janvier 2003. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus depuis plus de 05 ans et l’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son activité et de servir le plus largement de clients. Deux de ces enfants sont à l’université et son objectif principal est de les soutenir financièrement dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Aissatou D. is a 47 years old woman, married and mother of six children, all of them over six years old. She is a member of the Village Bank of Sinthiang AIDAR; she has been the Treasurer since January 28, 2003. She has run a small textile business for over five years and with this loan she wants to improve her business and better respond to her customers demand. Two of her children are in college and she wants to be able to support them financially in their studies.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve a textile business

loans.name: Linda Arasan Group

texts.en:
Linda A. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, a widow, and has four adult-aged children. Linda is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Linda A. Group.

To make a living, Linda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Linda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Linda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fifth taken out by Linda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul D. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more rice and beans to cook and sell. Rasul is 33 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more rice and beans to cook and sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth P. is 42 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Bagong Sikat outside of Alicia, a municipality of Isabela Province on Luzon Island. Elizabeth owns and runs a general store from which she sells both food and products for daily use to the local community. She has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan, her sixth from ASKI, for 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline K. is currently in the business of selling bags of groundnuts and simsim (sesame seeds) at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize and millet to sell.  

Jackline is 37 years old and married to a peasant. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock bags of maize and millet to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lidia O. D. L. nació en la ciudad D. Luque, está casada con Gabriel Leguizamón Coronel con quien tuvo tres hijos, dos D. ellos aun menores.
Ambos se dedican a la confección D. prendas D. vestir como remeras, pantalones cortos entre otros.
 Los créditos que anteriormente retiraba D. la  Fundación Paraguaya lo destinaron a la compra D. una máquina y menor escala y a la compra D. telas para los diferentes pedidos.
Hoy en día la señora Lidia invierte todo el préstamo que la Fundación le otorga a la compra D. telas esto debido a la cantidad D. pedidos D. prendas que tiene. En adelante quiere seguir ampliando su clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia O. D. Leguizamón was born in the city of Luque. She is married to Gabriel Leguizamón with whom she had three children of which two are still minors. She and her husband make articles of clothing like t-shirts, shorts, etc. The previous loans from Fundación Paraguaya were used to buy a sewing machine and fabric for their various orders. Today, Lidia will use the entire loan that the Fundación grants to buy fabric due to the quantity of pending orders for clothes she has. In the future she wants to continue to increase her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Kiribedda Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
28-year-old Henry W. who belongs to Kiribedda Group in Mpigi, Uganda, is honest when he gives credit to his close friend who he says prevailed upon him to start his current shoe sales business. Since then he has done all he can not to fall short of his envisioned goals. With a determined and unwavering attitude Henry has succeeded in making profitable use of his time at the helm of this business. This single father of one says he makes 50,000 UGX weekly.

With this loan he wants to buy more pairs of new shoes to sell. He is also looking at starting a brick-making business. Henry says that he had a retail shop before turning to shoe sales and does not regret his move.

loans.use: To purchase new pairs of shoes to sell

loans.name: Sylvie Léa Laure

texts.fr: H. Sylvie Léa Laure est née le 21 Décembre 1963 et est mariée à DJIHOUAN Nestor, un peintre. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille s’est installée à Adogléta, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Léa Laure a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour venir en aide à son mari dans les différentes charges du ménage, Léa Laure vend divers produits (sucre, conserves de tomate et de sardine, piles,  lait, savons, papier de toilette, etc.) à Cotonou. De façon secondaire, Léa Laure vend des fournitures scolaires. Léa Laure s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Léa Laure sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue d’agrandir son étalage et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Sylvie Léa Laure H. was born on December 21, 1963. She is married to Nestor Djihouan, a house painter. They have three children, all of whom attend school. The family has settled in Adogléta, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Léa Laure has left school at the secondary level. In order to help her husband support the family, Léa Laure sells various general goods (sugar, canned tomatoes and sardines, batteries, milk, soap, toilet paper etc) in Cotonou. In addition, she also sells school supplies. Léa Laure stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This is the second time that Léa Laure is seeking financing from ALIDé, with the goal of enlarging her stand and better meeting customer demand.

loans.use: Purchasing miscellaneous products and school supplies

loans.name: Kafa

texts.en:
Kafa is a married woman from Jenin city in Northern Palestine; her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a salary which barely covers household expenses.
Kafa’s husband want to improve their life, therefore he will start a small business with friends and start selling cars. Kafa’s husband saved a good amount of money and needs $2000 to start; therefore she came to FATEN and received the needed amount.
Kafa’s husband appears in the picture here in FATEN’s office when receiving the loan as Kafa is a religious woman and doesn’t want her picture published

loans.use: Start cars business

loans.name: We Go Able Group

texts.en:
Mohamed S. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in Masimera village about fifty years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and he has thirteen children, ten of whom are still attending school. For over thirty years now, he has been a businessman, and he sells house-building materials.

They are seeking a loan of SLL 3,900,000 in order to boost their respective businesses. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mohamed S. will use his share of the loan (SLL 1,200,000) to buy a large number of house-building materials to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy a large number of house-building materials to add to his business inventory

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina, de 39 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edwin de 40 años y su querido hijo Cristhian de 5 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. La tienda de abarrotes de Reina es una de las más concurridas en el poblado de Kimbiri, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 8 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, ya que tiene que atender de corrido si no quiere que sus ventas bajen. Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el almacén principal de su pueblo. Este el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mas provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Reina, age 39, is a kind and simple woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Edwin, age 40, and their beloved five year old son Cristhian for whom she wants to provide a better future. Reina owns a grocery store that is one of the busiest in the town of Kimbiri. Her great charisma and friendly service have made her business a favorite among her neighbors, who do not hesitate buying from her since her store is the first to open and the last to close. What she enjoys most about her work is conversing with her neighbors about the events that are happening in their town. Reina has been in business for eight years and considers the most difficult part to be spending the entire day in her store since she must always be present or else her sales will go down. In the future, she expects to grow her business until it becomes the main supplier in the community.

This is her second loan with MFP. Reina knows that she must pay on time in order to access another loan from her Communal Bank without complications. She is well-liked by the other members. With the loan of 2000 PEN that she requested, Reina will buy more provisions for her grocery store so that can increase her inventory of products.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nelda

texts.es: Nelda, de 39 años, convive con Julian, de 40 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores: Tatiana, de 20, Sherly de 18 y Kevin de 16 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Está carismática mujer cuenta que desde niña, su madre le enseñó a tejer y desde entonces se divierte mucho elaborando diversas prendas de vestir. “De eso hace 20 años, nunca pensé que ganaría dinero divirtiéndome”, menciona. Durante la semana Nelda, viaja a las ciudades de Cerro de Paco, Oroya y Junín, donde vende sus tejidos a buen precio. Ahora ella tienen planeado abrir una galería en la ciudad turística de Huancayo, ahí los tejidos de chompas, chalecos y gorras; principales tejidos de Nelda, tienen mayor demanda y pagan buen precio por ello. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo de trabajo arduo en su banco comunal; pudo encontrar apoyo en la realización de sus objetivos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, le ayudará en la compra de materiales como: Lana de diversos colores, y si el dinero le alcanza podrá comprar mercadería para poder venderlo en su próximo viaje.
texts.en: Nelda, age 39, has a common law marriage with Julian, who is 40 years old. They have 3 younger children together: Tatiana, 20, Sherly 18, and Kevin, 16. Together as a family, they live in their own house, located in the region of San Pedro de Cajas. This charismatic woman, says that since she was a child, her mother has taught her how to knit. Since then, she has really enjoyed making clothing garments. "20 years ago, I never thought that I would make money while enjoying myself," she says. During the week, Nelda travels to the cities of Cerro de Paco, Oroya, and Junín, where she sells her garments at a good price. Now she has planned to open a gallery in the tourist city of Huancayo, where she will have garments such as sweaters, vests, and hats. Nelda's main garments have a high demand and people pay a good price for them. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and in all this time of hard work in her communal bank, she hasn't been able to find support in the realization of her objectives. The loan that she will obtain will help her to buy materials such as different colored wool, and if the money allows, she will be able to buy merchandise to sell on her upcoming journey.

loans.use: To buy multicolored wool.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; La socia tiene 2 hijos ella es conviviente, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene su puesto de venta de frutas, la socia compra al por mayor de los proveedores y ella vende al por menor la fruta en la calle, la socia desea a corto plazo tener un buen capital para comprar más frutas a medida que se le acabe las que tiene y de este modo poder ahorrar con todos los ingresos que genere la venta de frutas para construir el terreno que tiene con su conyugue y poder darles mejor comodidad a sus menores hijos, la socia trabaja todos los días incluyendo los fines de semana, ella está por las mañanas hasta la hora de almuerzo vendiendo sus frutas, ella deja todo listo muy temprano antes de salir a su negocio para que sus hijos puedan almorzar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el capital para comprar frutas al por mayor para abastecerse.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Sr. De Tayancani”.  The bank is located in the Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Nancy.  She has two children and lives with her partner.  She has a retail stand where she sells fruit.  She buys wholesale from suppliers and sells the fruit on the street.  She would like to have capital to buy more fruit in the short run when she sells what she has, and thus be able to save the earnings from the sales.  She wants to build a house on the land that she and her partner have and give her children a more comfortable life.  She sells fruit every day, including weekends, from morning to lunch time.  She leaves everything ready in her house before she goes out so that her children can have lunch.  She is requesting a loan for capital to buy fruit wholesale to supply her business.

She appreciates and values the loan offered her this way and promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan for working capital to buy fruit wholesale to supply her business.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa M. is divorced and has  two children. She pursued her education through senior high school.  Adwoa sells clothes in Takoradi. She has been in this trade for some time now, and she uses her income to improve to the welfare of her family's home.  

Adwoa will use the loan to purchase more clothes for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Chubak

texts.en:
Chubak S. is a 40-year-old farmer. He has very tight-knit family with five children. His wife works as a nurse at the local hospital.
 
In order to support his family, Chubak decided to start his own business in cattle breeding and land cultivating with wheat, barley and alfalfa. Owing to his persistent, hardworking personality, Chubak, with starting capital of 10000 KGS, managed to multiply his investments and now earns about 3000 KGS in a month. Also, in seasons of harvesting, he works as a truck driver and helps his countrymen to gather their crops.
  
Chubak plans to use the loan of 100000 KGS to expand his farm by buying two colts and bull-calves for fattening and reselling. With the revenues from the loan, he plans to pay for the education of his children and broaden his business by purchasing more cattle. 

Chubak is an attentive father and makes every effort to make his dream come true: He wants to see his children become educated and cultured persons.
  
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina B. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Gina is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling longganisa or home made sausage in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Gina is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed for making longganisa, like spices and pork. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients, like spices and pork, needed for making longganisa.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara Q. is a 51-years-old woman. She is married and lives with her husband and five children in Agsu. All her children are adults, aged between 27 and 16, and help their parents. But they mainly depends on the income from their cattle-breeding business which Tamara and her husband decided to start in 2003. She requested her 1st loan from AqroInvest and Kiva in January. With the support of this loan in thye amount of 2000 AZN she was able to purchase four more cows and in this way to increase her monthly income up to 300 AZN. Now there are six head of cows in her farming. Tamara is hard-working woman and her hope is to buy a bigger piece of land for farming.

loans.use: to buy four cows

loans.name: Narcita

texts.en:
Narcita B. is from the village of Barucboc. She is 38 years old. Narcita is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Narcita plants and harvests rice to sell. Narcita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 35000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Narcita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narcita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. The previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Narcita is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be Narcita's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, age 50, is a charcoal vendor. She and her husband, who is employed as a driver, have seven children, all of whom go to school. Alice is requesting a loan in order to to stock more charcoal to sell. With the extra prfits expected from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Yunes

texts.en:
Yunes C. is 53 years old, married, and has eight children between the ages of 10 and 32, four of whom attend school. Yunes lives in Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya and is a dairy farmer. She has been in the farming business for 15 years and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk to the local tea estate through Kenya Tea Development Authority. 

Yunes is requesting for a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable her to improve her family's livelihood and pay school fees for her children. She says that lack of enough land to plant pasture and lack of reliable artificial insemination services have been her major challenges. In future, she would like to advance her dairy farming to a more profitable business by acquiring high-yielding dairy cows that will improve her milk production.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie G. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Julie is separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Julie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages,  shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Julie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Julie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Julie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages, instant noodles & biscuits. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Julie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like beverages, instant noodles & biscuits.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua H. is the mother of eight. Married to a farmer, she helps support the family by selling waakye, which is rice cooked with beans, usually served with a fish stew. She has been in this business for five years and her earnings pay for their kids’ school fees and some household expenses.
 
She is keen to grow her business so that she can save up for her children’s higher education. Her loan from Kiva will allow her to purchase more rice, beans and other ingredients to increase the volume of food for sale. She intends to set aside the additional earnings for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, beans and other ingredients to increase the volume of food for sale.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a vender en los tianguis y en su casa chanclas de plástico para niño, niña, dama y caballero, también vende fruta de temporada como mangos, melones, limones, guayabas etc. las frutas las compra en las huertas ya que así ella le puede ganar un poco más al venderlos. Doña Carmen esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para surtir su negocio de chanclas ya que en esta temporada de calor es cuando mas se le venden, tiene con este negocio 3 años y emprendió este tipo de negocio para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, ella dice “me gusta trabajar por que me gusta tener mi propio capital y no atenerme a lo que mi esposo me da y así podemos ahorrar para cuando este mas grande nuestro hijo darle estudios”. Ella surte sus chanclas en la cuidad de México ya que aya le dan un buen precio, doña Carmen agradece a la financiera por el préstamo por que si podrá invertir en mas variedad en sus chanclas, la meta que tiene ella es abrir un local en su casa donde pueda vender sus chanclas y accesorios para dama.
texts.en:
Carmen is a very hard working woman.  She sells plastic sandals for children, women and men at swap meets and at home and also sells seasonal fruit like mangoes, melons, lemons, guavas, etc.  She buys the fruit from orchards so that she can earn a bit more from her sales.

Carmen is asking the financial institution for a loan to stock her business with sandals because during this hot season is when they sell the most.  She’s had this business for three years and started it to help her husband meet household expenses.  She says: “I like to work because I like having my own capital and not have to rely just on what my husband gives me and we can save up so that when our son is older we can provide him with schooling.” 

She stocks up on the sandals in Mexico City because she gets them at a good price.  Carmen is grateful to the financial institution for the loan because she’ll be able to buy a wide variety of sandals.  Her goal is to open a locale at home where she can sell sandals and women’s accessories.

loans.use: to buy seasonal sandals and fruit.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is married and has 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Monalisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. Monalisa has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Edwin Manfredis

texts.es:
Edwin, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, es soltero, este trabajo lo hace desde hace ocho años, lo aprendió de su padre, quien le enseño todo el proceso necesario para hacer la milpa, el horario es de 6:00am a 2:00pm.
El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para las plagas, esta será una gran ayuda para Edwin, que le permitirá tener un buen cultivo con posible buena cosecha.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus padres a cubrir los gastos de la casa e ir progresando poco a poco para su propia superación.
texts.en:
Edwin is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He is single and has been in this line of work for eight years.  He learned the business from his father who taught him how to grow his crops.  He works from 6.00am to 2.00pm.

Edwin needs this loan to buy manure, fertilizers and pest treatments.  This will be a big help as it will allow him to have a good crop and a good harvest.

Edwin's goal is to help his parents to cover their household expenses and to continue making gradual progress in order to improve himself.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and pest treatments

loans.name: Elvira Gregoria

texts.es: El cliente de nombre: ELVIRA, productora de legumbres, también se dedica a la crianza de ganados vacunos, avícola, etc. Debido a la crianza de estos es que nuestra clienta no tiene gastos por compra de abono ella también cuenta con un terreno en la zona de CHINCHAYA el cual le ayuda en realizar el cambio de tierra de su carpa solar  el cual lo realiza cada 4 meses, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para plantar legumbres. En general nuestro cliente no tiene muchos gastos operativos. El esposo de nuestra clienta tiene la actividad de albañilería, pero por el momento se encuentra en El País de estados Unidos por un contrato de su jefe que lo llevo en el mes de Marzo por un periodo de 6 meses, de igual manera les gira dinero para sus niños los cuales son tres que se encuentran en edad escolar, es un apersona trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The client named ELVIRA is a vegetable farmer.  She is also engaged in raising cattle, poultry, etc.. It is because of the raising of these livestock that our client does not have expenses for purchasing fertilizer.  She also has some land in the CHINCHAYA area, where she changes over her greenhouses every 4 months.  The money from the loan will be used to buy seeds to plant vegetables.  In general, our client does not have many operating expenses. Our client's husband works in masonry, but at the moment he is in the United States on a contract for his boss, who took him there in March for a period of six month.  In this way they are earning money for their three school age children.  She is a hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the assistance provided.

loans.use: to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Efren Ignacio

texts.es:
Efren de 49 años,  vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil. Su esposa es ama de casa y vende comesticos de Yanbal y tienes tres hijos de 18 16 y 14 años que estudian en colegios fiscales. Tiene una papelería en donde vende diferente articulos de bazar y pañales.

Como anteriormente tenia una pequeña sastrería hace 12 años y luego comenzó a invertir poco a poco en la papelería desde hace 8 años. Labora de 7H00 am a 7H00 pm diariamente. Con el apoyo del préstamo desea compras mas mercadería como pañales cuadernos y artículos escolares para surtir el negocio. En un futuro desea ampliar su negocio y adecuar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Efren, who is 49 years old, lives in the urban area of "El Guasmo" in Guayaquil.  (El Guasmo got its name from the tree species "Guazuma Ulmifolia."  El Guasmo is a working-class neighborhood that was formerly a ranch).  Efren's wife is a homemaker who sells Yanbal cosmetics.  They have three children ages 18, 16 and 14.  They all study in public schools.  Efren owns a stationary store.

Twelve years ago Efren owned a small tailor's shop.  Eight years ago he began to invest, little by little, in the stationary store.  He works from 7:00am to 7:00pm every day.  With the help of the loan, he wants to purchase more merchandise like diapers, notebooks and school supplies to stock up his business.  In the future, Efren hopes to expand his business and fix up his home.

loans.use: to purchase diapers, notebooks and school supplies.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha provincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique casado  e pai de 2 filhos de 4 e 12 anos de idade o mais velho vai a Escola. Fez 8ªclasse e parou devido a falta de condiçoes financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Namaacha para Maputo a procura de emprego, trabalha como  motorista permanente numa empresa privada ha mais de 10 anos e tem um   rendimento mensal de 8.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição.
