Roland has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roland joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roland is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roland from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide transportation services

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Luisa T., 54, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Dante T. and the mother of three children.

Luisa operates a variety store and bakery. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for buying one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Ma. Luisa earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at piece rate. Ma. Luisa’s store and bakery is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of $4.40 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 34,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She also will invest some of the loan to purchase bread-making ingredients like flour, sugar and butter. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Luisa dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of products to expand her inventory, and to purchase bread-making ingredients like flour, sugar and butter

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida B. is from the village of Simimbaan. She is 49 years old. Zenaida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Zenaida is just starting this business. In 2010, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Zenaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly oarmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Once you stop short of any measures aimed at uplifting your livelihood whether through doing business or through hard work in your trivial job, hard circumstances will be the order of your recurrent days. These are odds 25 year old L. Bashir did not want to face, having experienced firsthand how many people around his locality were suffering as a result of taking counter-productive decisions in their lives. 

Bashir is a courteous and warm hearted gentle young man who is a father of 1 child. 3 years ago he embarked on his retail shop business in Kimenyedde-Kayunga. In a week, he makes profits totaling to 190,000 shillings and in the near future, he is thinking about opening up a super market or going wholesale. With this loan, he wants to buy more retail stock for his shop. He is anticipating buying items such as rice, sugar, soap, beans and flour. With increased profits, he says he will be able to save more so that he make his dream of either opening a super market or going wholesale come true.

loans.use: The purchase of items such as rice, sugar,soap and maize flour to resell

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 31 years old and married.  Theogene is commonly known for selling firewood and he has been in this business for about five years.  The business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Theogene, after realizing that he is not able to satisfy the demands of his customers, needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, he will hopefully expand his market as well as his profits.  If successful, he will purchase more firewood for sale, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua D. is married and takes care of four children. Her husband is a petty trader. She has not acquired any formal education. Efua sells 'kenkey' (a fermented maize staple food) at Elmina. Efua uses her income to help her husband in the payment to school fees and utility bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare 'kenkey' for distibution. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to invest in the sale of other cereals.

loans.use: purchase more maize to prepare 'kenkey' for distibution

loans.name: Eduardo Aurelio

texts.es:
Eduardo de 48 años, sale a recorrer las calles de Guayaquil para vender “pastelitos” son hecho de harina, carne y pollo. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Empezó hacer pastelitos cuando una amiga de el le propuso trabajar junto elaborando pastelitos. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora el recorre las calles de Guayaquil como vendedor de pasteles, mientras que el sale a recorre las calles para vender su amiga hace los pastelitos de carne y pollo. 

Para tener mas ingresos el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento y bloques para construir mejor su casa y así tener espacio para hacer un local de pastelitos. En el futuro quiere termina de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 48 years old and works in the streets of Guayaquil to sell small cakes made of flour, meat, and chicken. He lives in a suburban area called Duran, which is known for its poor ecological state. He began to make small cakes when a friend of his asked him to work together making the cakes. Since that time until now he walks the streets of Guayaquil as a street vendor of small cakes, while his friend cooks the cakes of meat and chicken. To gain more income, he wants to purchase cement and bricks with the loan to better construct his house and in that way have space to establish a shop to sell cakes. In the future he wants to finish constructing his house.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement and bricks

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a mother of four daughters and three sons, her husband Samer owns a grocery store in Tulkarem, Amal and her husband run the store which helps them cover household expenses and children school expenses.

Amal and her husband came to FATEN as they needed to increase the returns from the store. Amal came to FATEN for a loan to increase their stock and have more goods exhibited in their store.

Amal’s husband Samer appears in the picture here as the family is very conservative and Amal doesn’t want to appear in the picture

loans.use: Improve the store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 36 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Augusto de 34 años que es chofer de transporte público  y de sus 4 hijos, de los cuales solo la última es menor. Desde muy joven se dedico a diversos oficios, pero siempre con la convicción de salir adelante  y en la actualidad trabaja en la venta de terrenos por la zona donde vive. Todos los días empieza su labor desde muy temprano y se extiende hasta la noche, espera paciente dentro de un modulo  para brindar informes, además de concretar contratos de personas interesadas y obtiene una comisión por cada terreno vendido. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque es tranquilo y no descuida la crianza de su menor hija, además obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar; y  como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de abarrotes, pues por el lugar donde vive no hay competencia, y quiere mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variedad de mercadería para empezar con el proyecto de su negocio, ya que calcula que obtendrá regulares ganancias.
texts.en:
María, 36, lives in her own home along with her husband Augusto, 34, who is a public transportation driver and her four children of whom only the youngest is a minor. Ever since she was very young she has taken on a variety of jobs but always with the determination to get ahead. Currently she works in land sales in the region where she lives. Every day she begins her labor very early and goes on until nighttime. She waits patiently inside a modular unit to provide information, in addition to drawing up contracts for interested persons, and receives a commission for each plot sold. She likes her work very much because it is peaceful and she need not neglect the care of her youngest daughter. Furthermore she receives regular earnings which allow her to help her husband with household expenses. 

As she is an enterprising woman, she is planning in the future to set up a grocery store given that there is no competition in the area where she lives and she wants to improve her earnings. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time as she wouldn't want to end up on bad terms with the people who made it possible for her to continue working in search of progress. María plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a variety of merchandise in order to begin her projected business, as she calculates she will obtain steady earnings.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for setting up a grocery business

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 36 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 6 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo al que Silvia se dedica, es el cultivo de café, cacao y hoja de coca. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella vende sus productos en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que quiere evitar la plaga de insectos en sus cultivos. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Este es el sétimo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidaria con ellos. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en: Silvia, who is 36, is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her six beloved children, who are the principal motive for all her efforts. Silvia grows coffee, cacao, and coca leaves. Every day, very early in the morning, she works in her fields, since she knows that the money that she obtains for her products will depend on the quality of her harvest. She sells her products in the city of San Francisco, a location where higher prices are offered. What she likes most about her work is harvesting her land, since it is then that she feels that the months of labor have born fruit. She has been doing this work for 10 years, and she thinks the most difficult part is fumigating her land, which she does because she wants to avoid plagues of insects on her crops. In the future she wants to buy new land to increase her production. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she feels that this support helps her a lot in the progress of her work. In her community bank she is well-liked by the rest of the members, since she is very united with them. With the 1000 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy more compost and fertilizer to improve the quality of her land.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve the quality of her land.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es: La Sra.  Yesica de 20 años,  de estado civil soltera, con un hijo de 2 años, tiene ya varios años dedicándose a la venta, comercialización y flete de polleras, actividad que realizaba junto a su madre desde muy temprana edad. La Sra.  Yesica envía su mercadería a los departamentos de Tarija, Beni y Cochabamba ya que cuenta con clientes fijos en dichos departamentos, ella se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la demanda que se presenta en estas épocas del año, y necesita  comprar material como telas e hilos para la confección  de sus productos. Ella  presenta un buen historial de deuda en la institución con la que  ha trabajado, es un apersona muy responsable y muy dinámica, se encuentra muy  agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Yesica, twenty, is single and has one two-year-old child.  She's been working for a number of years marketing, selling, and distributing skirts.  She's been working with her mother from a very early age.  She sends her merchandise to the departments of Tarija, Beni and Cochabamba where she has steady clients.  She found herself in need of a loan from us because due to demand this time of year she needs to buy materials like fabrics and thread to sew her garments.  She has a good credit history with the institution she's worked with.  Yesica is a very responsible and dynamic person, and she is very grateful to us for the support we offer.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mahanaim Group

texts.es:
Ellos son el grupo Mahanaim y está conformado por catorce personas, las cuales cada una cuenta con una actividad para ayudar con los ingresos en sus hogares. Ello se ubican en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. 

Zeferina Hernández Hernández de 30 años de edad cuenta con una familia integrada por su esposo Albino y Manases su hijo, de quien se siente orgulloso. Ella  tiene una tienda en su comunidad desde hace un año, y sus ventas han ido incrementando, ya que no le costó trabajo aclientarse, su esposo le ayuda atender la tienda y así también esta al pendiente de su casa, gracias a la perseverancia ha logrado que sus ingresos aumenten. Con el crédito que reciba piensa comprar mercancía como: frijol, arroz, productos enlatados, sopas, etc. A las personas les gusta el trato amable que brinda y es por eso que regresan a comprar. Sus planes son poder seguir con sus ventas y que su hijo pueda terminar una carrera para que tenga un buen porvenir.

Los demás integrantes son:
Víctor Fidel R. C. (Taxi)
Beatriz O. C. (Venta de Piñatas)
Raquel C. Álvarez (Perfumes y cosméticos por catalogo)
Aquilina Z. Hernández (venta de blancos por catalogo)
Juan José R. C. (Venta de playeras y pantalones)
Olivia García C. (Renta de madera)
Alejandra Sánchez O. (Venta de Dulces y Frituras),
Guadalupe María Guzmán C. (Venta de dulces).
María Magdalena Juárez L. (Venta de carne)
Sara Z. Hernández (Venta de macetas y plantas)
Catalina Z. Hernández (Tienda de ropa)
Graciela Martínez Hernández (Tienda de Ropa)
Gerardo C. Álvarez (Albañilería)

Mahanaim agradece el apoyo brindado que recibe de Kiva por parte de Fundación Realidad ya que esto les ayudara a cumplir sus metas
texts.en:
This is the Mahanaim group which has fourteen members.  Each member has a business activity which helps with their household income.  The group is located in Valle de Chalco, in the State of Mexico.

Zeferina Hernández Hernández is 30 years old.  Her family is her husband Albino and her son Manases of whom she feels proud.  She has had a store in her community for one year and her sales have been increasing since it wasn't hard for her to attract customers.  Her husband helps her to serve in the store and also helps look after the house.  Thanks to her perseverance, she has managed to increase her income.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise such as: beans, rice, canned goods, soups, etc.  People like the kind service which she provides and, for this reason, they return to buy from her.  Her plans are to be able to continue with her sales and for her son to finish university so that he can have a good future.

The other members of the group are:

Víctor Fidel R. C. (Taxi service)
Beatriz O. C. (Piñata sales)
Raquel C. Álvarez (Perfume y cosmetic sales from a catalog)
Aquilina Z. Hernández (White goods sales from a catalog)
Juan José R. C. (T-shirts and pants sales)
Olivia García C. (Wood sales)
Alejandra Sánchez O. (Sweets and fried food sales)
Guadalupe María Guzmán C. (Candy sales)
María Magdalena Juárez L. (Meat sales)
Sara Z. Hernández (Plant pot and plant sales)
Catalina Z. Hernández (Clothes store)
Graciela Martínez Hernández (Clothes store)
Gerardo C. Álvarez (Building work)

The Mahanaim group are grateful for the support which they have received from Kiva through Fundación Realidad since it will help them to achieve their goals.

loans.use: To buy groceries, sheets, plants, wood, cardboard for piñatas, etc

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David N. is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He is 42 years old and married and he his 6 children, 4 of whom are still in school. 

David is a farmer who grows and sells produce, such as Irish potatoes, beans, maize, and matooke (green plantains).  He also buys produce from other farmers in the Katareiha area. His customers are daily transporters from different towns and he is able to make 30,000/= (Kenyan shillings) in profit each week. David is also involved in music production; all self initiated and motivated businesses. 

David needs a loan to be able to purchase more produce to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more produce to sell

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste N. is 23 years old. He is married and has a 2-year-old child. 

Theoneste sells a variety of useful goods such as sugar, rice and cooking oil. He has three years of experience and the hours of his business are from 6:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. 

Theoneste will use this loan to purchase a variety of goods for resale. With any profit he makes, he plans to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase variety of goods

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna G., 26 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has one child. She grows rice for a living. Her husband is also a farmer and they both work hard to keep their farm productive. Lorna also spends some time raising pigs in their backyard. Some day she wishes to open up a small sari-sari store, but right now, she wants to focus on farming. 

Lorna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizers

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora M. is a married woman who lives in Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She earns her living by a operating general store.

Her husband, Rey, who is 38 years old, works as a businessman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  

They have three children who are between 3 and 14 years old. 

Nora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, with which she intends to buy more grocery items to sell so that she can continue to save up for future improvements to the business and the education of her children. 

Nora is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. is from the village of Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old, widowed and has 5 school-aged children. Nancy owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling vegetables such as cabbage, ube (purple yams), red bell peppers and tomatoes in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables, such as cabbage and string beans, to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.fr: Dame  Akouélé  est mariée et a 5 enfants. Elle est âgée de 46 ans.  Elle exerce comme  activité  la vente de  produits d’alimentation  générale.  Elle  a commencé  en  1996 et  s’approvisionne au grand  marché de  Lomé.  Ensuite elle revend  les produits à son domicile à Avépozo à côté de la pharmacie.  Elle  demande  un crédit pour acheter  3 paniés de tomate, 2 paniés de piments, 2 cartons de tomate et 2  bidons d’huile.
texts.en: Akouélé is married and has five children. She is 46 years old. She has a business selling general food products. She began this business in 1996 and gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé. She then sells her products from her home next to the pharmacy in Avépozo. She is requesting a loan to buy three baskets of tomatoes, two baskets of peppers, two cartons of tomatoes and two containers of oil.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 53 years old and married with eight children. With four children in school, Ester works very hard to provide for them.

Ester runs a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell.

Ester has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sweet items and other miscellaneous items.  

In the future, Ester would like to expand her business and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of items to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Violeta would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of items to sell

loans.name: Diloramhon's Group

texts.en: Diloramhon A. is the treasurer of this group. She is 28 and married. Her husband is a constructor and when he has free time, he works as a taxi driver. Together they are bringing up three daughters and a son. The two older daughters are at school and the other children are not yet as they are preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money, Diloramhon sells convenience goods. She started this activity three years ago by selling seeds and chewing gum. Now, as a result of her successful business, she has expanded her activity and rented a place for trade. She earns 3,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more convenience goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to start repairing her house and build a summer kitchen. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Yury Monserrate

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yury, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una linda nena de 2 años y seis meses. El marido es comerciante vende artesanía.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta porque se lleva muy bien con todas sus compañeras.

Ella además de estar al tanto de su pequeña hija también se dedica al comercio, compra y vende artesanías como adornos y cerámicas, tiene un  local en la casa de sus suegros en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, ella trabaja con su esposo, él se encarga de darles el acabado a las obras ya que las compran semi terminadas para luego venderla a sus clientes. Llevan tres  años con su negocio y le ha ido bastante bien. Sus productos compran a artesanos de la zona.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer  crédito ellos empezaron su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que viven en la casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
In La Pila in the Montecristi canton the La Pila community bank meets every two weeks. This place is very well known in the province and on the country for its rich cultural tradition. A large vareity of artisanal crafts can be foun din this place, made by its inhabitants following their tradition customs.  

Here we meet Yury. She is 22 years old and is in a common law marriage and a mother of a beautiful 2 years and six month old daughter. Her husband is a merchant who sells artisanal craft. She has been in the community bank for three years. She is the secretary of the bank and shelikes it because she gets along well with all of the other members.  

Besides taking care of her young daughter, she is also a merchant. She buys and sells artisanal crafts such as ornaments and ceramics. She has a store in her parents in law's house where she sells all types of artisanal crafts. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. with her husband. He is in charge of finishing the objects since they buy them semi-finished. She has been in the business for three years and it has gone very well for her. She buys her products from area artisans.  

This loan is to buy more artisanal crafts in all types and designs to supply her business. She has spent three years in the community bank and she likes it because they started their business with the first loan. 
 
Her dream is to have her own house, since they live in their in-law's house.

loans.use: to buy all types of artisanal crafts.

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Рачабали проживает в Дангаринском районе. Возраст, 24 года. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей у себя дома. Он в основном занимается продажей обуви. Этим видом деятельности занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара. То есть он хочет закупить детскую обувь и одежду.
texts.en: Rajabali lives in Dangara. He is 24 years old, married, and has one child. His wife is a housewife. He works trading from home. He primarily sells shoes.  He has been doing this work for five years.  He is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods. He wants to buy children's shoes and clothes.

loans.use: to buy children's shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene is 38 years old and married, with two children, ages 5 and 12, and two dependent relatives. 

Helene has a boutique where she sells soap, body lotion, bread, etc. She has four years' experience and one employee to help her. Her business is open from 5:30 a.m. until 18:30 p.m. every day.
 
Helene has requested a loan from Kiva in order to increase her boutique's stock by buying more quantity of water, juice, bread, soap, cooking oil, etc. 

With the additional profits from this, Helene will reinvest in her business and renovate her own house.

loans.use: To increase the stock of her boutique by buying water, juice, bread, soap, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: El Grupo Dinamico Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge Augusto D. 48 años D. edad es el sustento D. su hogar, tiene una nieta D. 5 años el cual es su adoración, todos los días muy temprano sale con su auto a trabajar como taxista para llevar el alimento diario, una D. sus mayores metas es comprarse un carro para mejorar su economía y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida y dejar el pago del alquiler diario.
El Sr. Jorge Augusto es el actual tesorero del Grupo Dinámico, grupo recién formado en EDAPROSPO, todos los integrantes  se dedican a las actividades D. transporte (taxi, mototaxi), mantenimiento D. loza deportiva, ayudante D. laboratorio, etc.
El reciente préstamo será invertido en el mantenimiento D. su auto.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Augusto, 48, is the bread-winner of the family.  He has a 5-year-old granddaughter who is the apple of his eye.  Every day he gets up early and goes out to work as a taxi-driver to earn an income.  One of his greatest goals is to buy a new car to improve his economic situation, give his family a better lifestyle and not have to pay daily rental.

Jorge Augusto is the current treasurer of "GRUPO DINÁMICO", a recently formed group in EDAPROSPO.  The members are involved in businesses such as transportation (taxi, moto-taxi), sports field maintenance, laboratory assistant, etc. 

The recent loan will be used for vehicle maintenance.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Blanca D. 32 años D. edad,es socia D. la Alcancia Comunal "Las Estrellitas D. San Antonio", es casada tiene 1 hija, La Socia aperturo un stand alquilado D. ventas D. útiles escritorios. El prestamo solicitado es para compras y ventas D. utiles D. escritorio como crepes, colores, crayolas, corrospun, lapiceros, borradores, etc. sus objetivos en el futuro es comprar su propio stand, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiare. La socia agradecen por la oportunidad   brindada para el capital D. trabajo D. sus negocios. ella esta en la primera fila lado derecha com chompa color rojo, pantalon color rojo.
texts.en: Blanca is 32 years old and is a member of the communal bank called "The Little Stars of San Antonio". She is married with one daughter. She has a rented stand where she sells writing supplies. The solicited loan is for the purchase and sale of writing supplies, such as crepe paper, crayons, pencils, ribbon, erasers, etc. Her objective for the future is to purchase her own stand. Her husband helps with the family expenses. She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her for working capital for her business. She is shown in the first row on the right siD. with the red colored sweater and red pants.

loans.use: to purchase ribbon, crepe paper, crayons, and pencils for her supply store.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, celibataire avec 5 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 12 et 26 ans.Depuis 24 ans , elle s'est lance dans la vente des planches, ses potentiels clients sont les menuisiers et charpentiers qui sont dans son quartier situe non loin d'un grand marche.
Ses ventes sont de 50.000frs a plus de 100.000 frs par jour.

A l'octroi de son pret elle va renforcer le stock des planches te que achat de 20 bastins de 10m, 20 bastings de 8 m, 50 contre plaques de 6m, lots de lattes de 6m et 50 chevrons 5m, 6m, et 7m.

A l'avenir, avec ses benefices elle veut agrandir son depot et aller au nord du pays pour aller acheter en gros  des convois de planches dans les societes forestieres et acheter aussi des scies moteurs pour le coupage du bois.
texts.en:
Clémentine, age 48, is unmarried and has 5 children to support, aged 12 to 26. She started selling planks 24 years ago, her potential customers are furniture makers and carpenters in her neighborhood, not far from a large marketplace. Her daily sales range from XOF 50'000 to 100'000 (ca US$ 100 to 200).

With her loan, she will bolster her stock by buying 10- and 8-meter planks (20 pieces of each), 50 pieces of plywood (6 meters), bundles of laths (6 meters), and 50 rafters (5, 6 and 7 meters).

In the future, she wants to use her profits to expand her depot, and travel to the north of the country in order to buy truckloads of planks wholesale from forest companies. She also would like to buy motored saws for cutting wood.

loans.use: to buy plywood, planks, laths, and rafters

loans.name: Las Cumplidas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA JESENIA DE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD CASADA CON UN HIJO ,ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO  LAS CUMPLIDAS.LA SRA JESENIA  SE DEDICA EN LA ACTUALIDAD  A LA  VENTA DE ABARROTES  EN  LA LOCALIDAD DE BARRIO PINCHA-PROVINCIA DE CHUPACA .JESENIA POCO A POCO ESTA MEJORANDO SU NEGOCIO,JESENIA SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER INCREMENTAR  LOS ABARROTES DE SU NEGOCIO Y ASI SURTIR MAS SU MERCADERIA DE SU NEGOCIO.LA SRA JESENIA  QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO ABRIR VARIAS SUCURSALES EN LA CIUDAD DE HUANCAYO. LA SRA JESENIA SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA  A LADO DERECHO
VISTE POLO COLOR BLANCO, CHOMPA COLOR FUCSIA QUE LLEVA EN BRAZOS A SU BEBE.  LAS FOTOS SUPERIORES SON DE ANA MARIA Y AIDA AMPARO.
texts.en:
Jesenia, 25, is married and has a son.  She’s a member of the “Las Cumplidas” group.  She currently sells groceries in the Pincha neighborhood in Chupaca Province.  Jesenia is gradually improving the business.  

She requested the loan to increase the amount of groceries in her store and better stock it.  Jesenia would like to open several branches in Huancayo in the future. 

Jesenia is on the right of the lady wearing the fuchsia sweater and carrying her baby.  Jesenia is wearing a brown polo shirt and gray jeans. The photos up top are of Ana Maria and Aida Amparo.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Kieru

texts.en:
Kieru, aged 25, is single and support his parents. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 6,000 Kenyan shillings.

He knew KADET through a registered client. He has applied for his second loan, which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to purchase sheep for fattening. He dreams that at his age of 35, he will be successful in all he does.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda tiene  55 años, es separada  y en la actualidad vive sola en su casa que es propia. DesD. su juventud aprendió todo lo concerniente a la costura y desD. hace 20 años consolidó su negocio, especializándose en la elaboración D. mandiles y faldas típicas D. su localidad. Esta iniciativa fue impulsada por la necesidad  D. generarse ingresos económicos puesto que sufrió con el abandono D. su esposo y tenía que afrontar y ver la manera D. mantener a sus 2 hijos. En el tiempo que ha transcurrido, ha logrado tener buenos beneficios D. su trabajo y su perseverancia la ha mantenido para superar dificultades como el robo D. su taller D. costura, que se encontraba en su misma casa. Hoy tiene su taller implementado, además cuenta con dos personas que la apoyan  en la costura. Mira con mucho optimismo su futuro y desea en adelante incrementar aún más su producción y tener maquinaria más sofisticada en su taller. Se entero D. MFP por medio D. un aviso que llegó a sus manos, solicitó información sobre las condiciones D. crédito las cuales a su parecer son convenientes para afrontarlos. El dinero que solicita, será destinado en la compra D. telas y conos D. hilos D. diversos colores.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 55 years old; she is separated and currently lives alone in her home, which she owns.  Since she was young, she has learned everything about sewing, and for the last 20 years she has had her own business specializing in the making the aprons and skirts that are typical of the area.  This initiative was propelled by her need to earn financial income after she suffered the abandonment of her husband.  Shehad to face up to it and find a way to proviD. for her two children. 

In the time that has passed since then, she has achieved positive benefits from her work.  Her perseverance has kept her going to overcome difficulties such as the theft of sewing from her workshop, which happened to her in this same house.  Today she has her workshop, and also has two people who help her with the sewing.  She looks to the future with much optimism, and wants to continue moving forward in increasing her production and getting more sophisticated machinery for her workshop.

She heard about MFP through an announcement that came her way; she requested information about the loan conditions, which in her opinion are suitable for her to meet.  The money that she is requesting will be directed for the purchase of fabrics and cones of threads in various colors.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads in various colors.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
“I learned that the only way you are going to get anywhere in life is to work hard at it. Whether you're a musician, a writer or a businessman, there is no getting around it. If you do, you'll win-if you don't you won't” simply stresses Mercy. Mercy is a 47-year-old hard-working businesswoman who sells dry goods in their community.

She offers dresses, shorts, pants and underwear, which she has been doing for eight years now. She is earning a net income of PHP 50,000 every month, which she uses for the education of her six children. Part of it, she invests in the bank for safety. She wants to put in additional goods to sell. For that reason, she wants a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy pants and shorts. A part of it will be used to improve her current business.

Hopefully, she will be succeeding in every opportunity that God has given to her to help others through offering jobs (hiring a saleslady) to people in their community.

loans.use: to buy pants and shorts

loans.name: Sabina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sabina, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y verduras, ella vive con su esposo y tres hijos, todos son mayores, Sabina tiene como medio de ingreso el negocio en el mercado municipal, su existencia es de 20 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia.
Actualmente comprara verduras, por ejemplo: tomates, chiles, cebollas, papas, güisquiles y también maíz para las tortillas, la inversión le ayudara para aumentar la mercadería en el negocio, adquiriendo frutos frescos que le permitan ofrecer a los clientes.
Su propósito es que el negocio a través del financiamiento, pueda mejorar y atraer más clientes, con ello lograra una mejor rentabilidad y ganancias para cubrir gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sabina sells tortillas and vegetables for a living.  She lives with her husband and three children, all of whom are adults.  As her source of income, Sabina has her business in the local market.  It has been there for 20 years, so she has experience.

Currently, she will buy vegetables, such as tomatoes, chillies, onions, potatoes, chayote, and also corn for tortillas.  The investment will help her expand her business' merchandise, allowing her to get fresh fruit to offer her customers.

Her goal is that her business, through financing, will be able to improve and attract more customers.  That would allow her to be more cost-effective and to earn more to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chillies, onions, potatoes, chayote, and corn

loans.name: Mahutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même agglomération au Bénin. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Johanan est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.Johanan est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Bénin. Johanan est une veuve qui a cinq enfants à charge.Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Johanan mène comme activité la vente de "l'Akassa" (une pâte à base de l'amidon du maïs) et des poissons frits. Johanan mène cette activité depuis huit ans. Johanan s’approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Johanan sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN, un quatrième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHUTIN group is made up of three people who live in the same town in Benin. This is the fourth time that the group has requested financial aid from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business. 

The group's representative, named Johanan, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Johanan is 47 years old and lives in Benin. Johanan is a widow with five children under her care. All the children are in school. In order to support herself and her children, Johanan runs a business selling "l'Akassa" (a paste made from corn starch) and fried fish. Johanan has been running this business for eight years. Johanan gets her stock at one of the largest markets in Benin. 

Aiming to satisfy her customers and increase her revenue and her income, Johanan, together with the other members of the MAHUTIN group, is requesting a fourth loan. The loans they received in the past have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn and groundnut oil

loans.name: Nancy Esperanza

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos. 
Nancy tiene una tienda en la provincia de Independencia, también tiene un camión que lleva carga de cualquier tipo, ella actualmente trabaja como secretaria en una agencia de viajes a la Selva, le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que le ayudan a poder administrar mejor su negocio, el ahorro le ayuda a poder comprarse algo cada cierre, ahora con el préstamo comprará llantas e invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para la tienda, la meta que tiene es poder comprar otro carro.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the "Florecer" communal bank. She is 29 and has two children. Nancy has a store in the province of Independencia. She also has a truck that carries cargo of any type. Currently she works as a secretary in a travel agency that arranges jungle trips. 

She really likes the training sessions that help her run her business better.  Her savings help her to buy something she needs after every close of business. Now with the loan she will buy tires, and groceries for the store. Her goal is to be able to buy another vehicle.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 5 boys all under the age of 10 and her husband runs a rental house. Hadija sells hot meals from her home. She's worked in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transporting supplies from the market and her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and clothing.

Hadija will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil. Hadija aspires to operate her own rental houses in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is married with four children. She is 60 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Clarita sells food for snacks to earn a living; she has had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan for 2000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Clarita became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Clarita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Karypbubu

texts.ru: Карыпбубу 53 года, замужем и имеет шестерых детей, младшие из которых школьники. Единственный сын Карыпбубу - Улан инвалид, но он прилагает все усилия для помощи матери в ведении хозяйства. В 1985 году, в поисках источника финансирования своей семьи, Карыпбубу начала свой бизнес в разведении скота и перепродаже сельхоз продукции. Карыпбубу использовала стартовую сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, и сумела развить свое хозяйство, с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Карыпбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов для откорма и перепродажи. В ближайшее время, при помощи доходов от кредита, Карыпбубу планирует увеличивать поголовье  скота.
texts.en: Karypbubu is 53 years old, married and has six children, the youngest still in school. Karypbubu's only son - Ulan is disabled, but he does his best to help his mother around the farm. In order to create a stable financial base for her family, Karypbubu started a livestock and produce business in 1985. She used her starting capital of 5,000 com (KGS) to purchase cattle and has developed her farm to yield a profit of 5,000 som (KGS) monthly. In order to further grow her herd, Karypbubu has turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She will use the loan to purchase sheep for fattening and resale. In the near future, using the profits from the loan, Karypbubu is planning to purchase more animals for her herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mawa Shg Group

texts.en:
Jackson is the facilitator of the Mawa SHG group. Jackson and his group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Jackson takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Jackson had a good maize yield harvesting seven and a half bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jackson was only able to harvest two and a half bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Jackson will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Mawa SHG group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Jackson is pictured with his group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
This is Juliana, 46, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pedro, a security guard.  At this time, she is working hard to be able to support their daily expenses.

Juliana operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm sized ones to the much larger doormats, braided quilts, bed sheets, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Juliana hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Daniel Duraman

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Daniel, a small scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 3,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to invest in his business. 

Daniel owns a grocery store on the outskirt of Magburaka town. He sells drinks, bread, chewing gums, mints, biscuits, toothpastes, salts, batteries, etc. Daniel has been a businessman for many years now. 

Fifty-seven year old Daniel is married to a businesswoman and the couple have five children, one of whom is in college, and the rest are no longer attending school. Daniel was born in the village of Magburaka town. This is his second Kiva loan. With the help of his first Kiva loan, Daniel's business expanded from a hawker to a proud shop owner. He has requested this loan in order to even further expand his business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to his shop.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread, chewing gums, mints, biscuits, toothpastes, salts, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en: Melissa is a 20-year-old single Lebanese woman. She’s living with her parents and two siblings. Her parents are taking care of the family and trying their best to cover all their needs. As for her, she started to work as a hair dresser and beautician from her home in 2009. She has loyal customers who believe in her fashionable and stylish haircuts and beauty designs. Today, she’s asking for a loan of $800 from Kiva partner Ameen S.A.L. to buy new cosmetics products such as nail polish, cotton balls, polish remover, and many other items. This will increase her sales by 30%. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics products such as nail polish, cotton balls, polish remover, and many other items.

loans.name: Wendy Arely

texts.es:
Wendy, con el propósito de seguir trabajando en su negocio solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar cerdos pequeños y crecerlos, para luego venderlos a buen precio.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho porque obtuvo ganancias al vender los cerdos y les pudo dar los alimentos a sus hijos y ahora viven más estable.
texts.en:
Wendy is requesting a new loan because she wants to carry on with her activity: she will buy piglets that she will breed to then sell them for a good price.
She says that her previous loan has been of great help for her because she earned money by selling the pigs, because she was able to provide for her children and because they now live in steadier conditions.

loans.use: To buy piglets to breed and sell.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella is 32 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married and has two children. 

Rosebella has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 900 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her business. 

Rosebella has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, she hopes to own a food stall. Rosebella is a loving mother and has a happy family. She and her husband want to send their children to school so that they can help them in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en: Felicity is a 37-year-old woman from the Eldoret area of Kenya. She has been a farmer for as long as she has been a wife. She operates on a small piece of land under her husband's name, keeping dairy and poultry and growing crops and trees. Felicity is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to pay for farm implements. Working with modern tools will make her work move faster and become more efficient. She expects to see major improvements in the quality and quantity of yields led by the use of improved tools.

loans.use: To pay for farm implements

loans.name: Kamathatha Mworoto Women Group

texts.en:
The Lady raising her hand in the photo is Grace. She is fifty five years old married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.
She does beans, goats and sheep farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. This will improve her beans production hence increase her income which she will use to pay school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and improve on beans production hence more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Siddaling

texts.en:
Mr.Siddaling P. – handicapped - aged 19 years is bachelor staying with his 5 family members. He was illliterate but is now able to read and write with the help of night school. He lives in a small village called Marapur in Mudhol taluka of Bagalkot district in Karnataka, India. He now does tailoring work in the village for Rs.50/- day. He would like to shift to dairy business by purchase one she buffalo. By rearing this buffalo he will be able to get about 12-15 liters milk per day and by which he will be able to earn an amount of Rs.125/- to Rs.150/- per day with a net profit of Rs.75/- to Rs.100/- per day. To purchase buffalo he requires a loan amount of Rs.15000/-. Loan repayment will be completed in 2 years and installment will paid every month.

*July 2006 exchange rate is 46 rupees to the US
dollar

loans.use: Purchasing a buffalo

loans.name: Sándor

texts.en:
Sandor A., married, father of one son, is the owner of a Cyber Cafe, which supports his family economically. He now has plans to expand his business and with the loan he recieves from PRISMA, he will buy 5 new computers and update the 5 computers he already owns. Futhermore, he plans on remodeling his cafe in order to install a small Bar, which he thinks will also help to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Sándor A., casado, padre de un hijo, es dueño de un Cyber café con el cual mantiene económicamente a su familia, actualmente tiene planes de agrandar su negocio, con el crédito que le otorgue PRISMA comprará 5 nuevas computadoras y actualizará las 5 computadoras que actualmente posee. Aademás acondicionará su local para instalar un pequeño Bar, con el cual piensa incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: The money obtained by PRISMA will buy more modern computers and to make improvements on the site.

loans.name: Matapa

texts.en: Matapa is from the Samoan village of Lotofaga Safata.  She’s thirty-one years of age with three kids.  Her primary goal is business success, and she works hard daily to achieve it.  She and her family rely on their daily catch for income.  Her husband does most of the fishing, while Matapa’s main job is hauling their catch to the local market and ensuring she is getting good prices.  She can earn up to ST 150 (USD 60) a day.  Matapa is confident that investing in her and her husband’s fishing business is the best way for to ensure an education and a bright future for her three small children.

loans.use: :  fishing nets, spears, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Khagani

texts.en: Khagani I. has been selling food in his small shop in Imishli since1998. The scale of his business is low in comparison with increased family expenses. Khagani is 36, is married, and has two children. With summer coming, he needs refrigerators for storage of food products. He has applied for a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase two refrigerators.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerators for his food store

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Business Description

Inés has a business selling perfume, cosmetics and costume jewelry. She provides the merchandise to her customers after they order it. Inés attends to her customers every day of the week from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.

Loan Use

Inés is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise in greater quantities and greater variety. Demand for her products has increased since there is an increasing number of people to whom she provides this merchandise. Naturally, Inés earns more per item -- having a greater profit margin -- when she is able to purchase in larger quantities. She also tells us that in this way she does right by her clients and can even pass on some of the savings to them.

Personal Information

Inés is 36 years old. She is a widow and has four children. She sees in her business the chance to provide a source of greater income for her family. It is Inés’s wish that her business continue to grow in order to increase her income and be able to provide food, education and greater security (both financial and in the home) for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Inés tiene negocio de venta de: perfumes, cosméticos y bisutería. Labora entregando estas mercaderías por pedidos. Inés nos dice que atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana desde las 8: AM a 20: PM.

Uso del Préstamo

Inés solicita el crédito para la compra de más productos su demanda se ha incrementado por motivo de que ella atiende un grupo de personas a quienes les provee de esta mercadería. Así Inés genera mayores ganancias por el margen de utilidad que obtiene a mayores compras. También nos dice que de esta manara cumple con sus clientes y da oportunidad de que otras personas también ganen.

Información Personal

Inés tiene 36 años 4 hijos es viuda y vio en este negocio su fuente de ingresos. Los anhelos de Inés es poder seguir creciendo con su negocio para así tener mas ingresos y poder darle a sus hijos. Alimentación, educación y seguridad en su hogar.

loans.use: Provide greater variety and quantity of merchandise

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, 37 years old, married with no children, is a very persistent and diligent woman. Her husband works in a construction firm in Santo Domingo. Ana owns a drinks store. She operates the business from 6 pm to midnight, and during the week-ends, she closes the store after 2 am. She sells different kinds of drinks, beers being the most sold beverages in the store. The atmosphere is very pleasant. Customers can dance while they drink.

Ana has a refrigerator to keep the drinks cold and a generator for the frequent power cuts in her area. The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to increase her inventory and introduce new kinds of drinks so that she can attract new customers. Given this loan, Ana will continue improving her family´s standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her inventory, purchasing wine, energy drinks, and beer for her drinks store

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs.Chantha N. married in 1986 and has two daughters. She started her grocery business in 2003. She attended training for sewing traditional Cambodian clothes, however, she is currently not in the business of sewing clothes. Her husband is currently serving as a police at the Prek Kampes commune. Their two daughters go to high school and they expect to send their children to pursue higher education so it will be easy for them to have a good job.

Mrs. N. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of US$ 200. She will use this loan to purchase more grocery items for her stock in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan B. is requesting a loan in order buy additional stock including thread. She also hope to buy another sewing machine with her loan.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en: Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 42 year-old Liberatha F.. She is married with six children, aged between 9 and 24. In 2005, Liberatha established a brick-making business, and now requires a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional supplies of cement and sand in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cement and sand for her brick-making business

loans.name: Manzurahon

texts.en: Manzurahon U. is 25 years old and she lives in the Asht region. She has a business selling food products and used a previous loan to improve her business and open a trade outlet in the food bazaar where she trades the different food products. She has a good assortment and repeat customers. Now Mrs. U. is applying to KIVA for a loan of $625.00 to purchase a large supply of sugar.

loans.use: To purchase a large supply of sugar

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 26-year-old man living  in Tripoli, in northern Lebanon,  with his family. Mohamad has 1 child. He owns a bakery store. This is the second time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy a juice and an ice cream refrigerator for the summer season.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 41 years old and is married with 6 children, ages 9 to 19. Mariam owns a small cafe, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (chairs, tables, snacks and drinks) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items (chairs, tables, snacks and drinks) for her business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C. lives in the Srey Praseur Village of Kampong Speu Province, where she works as a farmer. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is studying at state school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband (pictured on the left) is a farmer and laborer who can generate a small amount of income to support their family.

Although her family members are engaged in different business activities, they still do not generate enough money to allow them to live in good conditions. In particular, the family would like to build a new house to replace their old house. Thus, Mrs. Mom C. is requesting a loan to supplement her income in order to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To improve her family's standard of living by building a new house for her family.

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Gloria is married and her husband is a bus driver. They have a 4 year old daughter. She started her business because she has always liked working and having her own business. She also wanted to help her husband financially, especially now that they are paying for their house, while still tending to her home and taking care of her daughter. She used to work at a store where she gained a lot of experience. Then over a year ago she started buying merchandise, effectively launching her grocery store.

Gloria is requesting a loan in the amount of $250, that she will pay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise. With your help she can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria es casada y su esposo es chofer de autobus. Tienen una pequeña de 4 años. Ella inició el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado trabajar y tener su propio negocio y atender su hogar, ademas de ayudarle economicamente a su esposo sin descuidar a su hija , sobre todo por que actualemnte estan pagando su casa. Ella trabajaba como empleada en una tienda, trabajo del cual adquirio experiencia hasta hace mas de un año compro mercancia iniciando su negocio de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda Gloria podra hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mr. Sun V. is a villager in Dambouk Kokaos Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He uses electricity to charge batteries for the local village. His wife, Mrs. Phally V., is a farmer. They have four children, two of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study.

Recently, Mr. Sun V.'s mother died and he does not have enough money to do a funeral, so he decided to ask for a loan to this purpose. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Do a funeral for his mother.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Malohat M. has operated a clothing store in the central market of Shahrituz town. Determined, hard working and enterprising, Malohat has successfully grown her business to provide a stable and consistent income. Currently, she earns over US$ 180 per month in profit.

Malohat is divorced and her business is a valuable source of income for her and her two adorable children. This has been her only income to support and educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to have the entire responsibility for her family. But her love for her children is what drives her forward from day to day.

Malohat wants to continue investing in her business. She is a long-term client at IMON and has successfully used the support of micro-loans to expand her business and generate additional income. Currently, Malohat is seeking a loan of 1000 Somoni (300 USD) with a term of 12 months to increase her inventory. With additional profits, Malohat plans to continue developing her business and become a more successful entrepreneur. Malohat promises to manage the current loan with accuracy as she did all the previous ones and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 41 years old. In 2004, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed loans to invest in her restaurant. Every day her husband buys raw food from agents and she uses these raw food to make dishes for customers. With high quality dishes, reasonable prices and enthusiastic service, her restaurant always attract a great number of customers and brings about an income of VND 3 million. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 12 million to buy more raw food and kitchen ware for her restaurant.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her restaurant

loans.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Imelda, socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Es profesora y complementa su trabajo con la venta de  productos de belleza, trabaja con pedidos. Su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en FONAVI Mz. H – Lt 19 y sus clientes son sus amigos, vecinos de su barrio y familiares. 
 
Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorantes, joyas, esmaltes, lociones, etc. para poder surtir su vitrina y tener en stock sus productos que luego ellas los venderá a precio de catalogo, generándole una mayor ganancia.

Tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con uno de sus hijos que cursa estudios superiores. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo decidida. Su meta es la de tener un local donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosa Imelda is a member of the "Manos Unidas" Community Bank. She lives in San Martin state and province, in Tarapoto district. She is a teacher and complements her work by selling special-order beauty products. Her business is located in her home at Fonavi Manzana, Lot 19. Her clients include her friends, neighbors and relatives. With this loan of 1,000 soles [about US $350] -- which will be paid back in six months -- Rosa plans to purchase sale-priced beauty products such as women's, men's and children's perfume and cologne; deoderants; jewelry; nail polish; lotions, etc. These purchases will ensure her window is well-supplied and her business well-stocked with products that she will sell at catalogue prices, resulting in a greater profit. Rosa is 48 years old and lives with her husband and one of their children, who is currently in high school. Her goal is to have a place where she can display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products (perfume, nail polish, lotion, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maria habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Sabana Grande desde su infancia, tiene 63 años de edad, en su matrimonio procreo once hijos cinco mujeres y seis varones lo cuales son independiente y trabajan, su esposo es comerciante, la Sra. Maria vende ropa, cosmético en su casa desde hace veintiocho años trabaja en las venta que vende al contado y al crédito, ella inicio con dinero propio que su esposo le dio y ahora trabaja con préstamo que Afodenic le atorgado para hacer mejoras a su negocio para seguir invirtiendo, con esta solicitud es la séptima y desea invertir en comprar ropa para niños y adultos para ofertar a sus clientes ya que para estos meses la demanda es bastante buena debido al periodo de la navidad que la personas alistan sus estreno que es la tradición de cada año, lo cual le genera buenos ingresos. A futuro es poder tener un local grande donde pueda tener bastante inventario.
texts.en:
Maria has lived in a neighborhood of the capital city called Sabana Grande since she was an child. She is 63 years old, married with 11 children, five daughter and six sons, all of whom are independent and working. Her husband is a merchant. Maria has been selling clothing and cosmetics in her house for 28 years, to customers paying in full with cash and on credit. She started out with money given to her by her husband and now is working with loans provided to her by AFODENIC to make improvements in her business. With this loan, which is the seventh, she would like to purchase adult and children's clothing to offer to her clients, since during the Christmas season her demand is quite high, during which she earns good income. In the future she would like to open a large location where she will be able to maintain a larger inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's and adult clothing

loans.name: Siv

texts.en:
Mrs. Siv S., 41, is married with two children and lives with her husband in Tboung Khmom district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife, cooking food for her family members, while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver, earning typically US$ 7/day for his household. Her two children are currently employed by a factory and can collectively make around US$ 200 per month.

After hearing about CREDIT MFI from one of her neighbors who is a longtime CREDIT client, Siv S. would like to request a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to replace her husband’s motor-bike, With any remainder of the loan she hopes to start up a grocery business at home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to replace his old one

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Zelmira

texts.es: Zelmira tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y sus dos hijos  menores de edad. Hace 2 años se dedica a la crianza de animales, ganado que le ayuda a tener grandes ganancias, ya que es más rentable por el consumo de carne de cordero en los mercados. Así también tiene algunas vaquitas, las cuales producen leche y puede venderla en los mercados de la ciudad y en los alrededores donde las ventas son muy buenas, pero para ello tiene que ordeñarlas desde muy temprano para ofrecer leche fresca a los vecinos para sus desayunos. Zelmira está en su 13avo préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tuvo problemas de pago y sigue siendo una socia estrella en su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en la compra de ganado, los cuales tienen un costo aproximado de 300 soles cada cordero.
texts.en:
Zelmira, 28, is a single mother. She lives with her parents and her two young children. Two years ago, she started a business raising sheep, a business that has helped her increase her earnings because the market pays a premium for lamb. She also has a few cows that produce milk, another product that sells well in the markets in and around the city, but a business that requires her to start very early in the morning because she has to collect the milk and sell it to her customers while it's fresh for their morning breakfasts. This is Zelmira's 13th MFP loan and she's repaid all of her past loans. She's a star among the members of her community bank. The loan will be used to buy sheep which cost around 300 soles per head.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow livestock business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La  señora Olga Ramona , domiciliada en la compañía Itá 
Potrero   de la  Ciudad  de  Itá, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, Francisco de 38 años quien es electricista y Fabio de 22 años de edad quien está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de derecho.

La misma se desempeña como costurera desde los 12 años de edad, dicho oficio aprendió de su familia, ya que la abuela y la madre eran costureras, pero no contenta decidió estudiar y terminando la Educación Básica estudió tres años Corte y Confección, 2 años manualidades y 1 año para el título de Profesora en Corte y Confección.
