Alice is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business. With this expansion, Alice will be able to satisfy her clients. Alice expects to earn more profit as long as her customers are satisfied. With this profit, hopefully, Alice will buy her own house.

loans.use: To buy different styles of clothes

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena K. prepares kenkey for sale at Takoradi. Mena has received senior high education. She is divorced and takes care of four children. She is responsible for the upkeep of the family.

Mena’s loan will be used to buy more maize to cook to distribute to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

To prepare her kenkey, Mena buys maize from the market and soaks it in enough water to soften it. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough from the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove (ferment and rise).

On the next day she divides the proved dough into two, uses one part for her firm half-cooked dough (she mixes it with water to get it in a porridge form and cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture) and mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She moulds it into balls and wraps the balls in corn husk. She then cooks them again until they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey and any other kind of meat or fish.

loans.use: To buy more maize to cook to distribute to her customers

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: L. señora Laura tiene una tienda D. abarrotes y su esposo trabaja en una maquiladora D. L. localidad, ellos son una pareja muy  unida y los dos contribuyen a los gastos D. L. casa, tienen dos hijos pequeños los cuales estudian.  L. señora Laura ya ha tenido crédito con nosotros y ah demostrado su excelente cultura D. pago, en esta ocasión elL. necesita D. este crédito para invertir en su negocio  ya que quiere comprar mas abarrotes para así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Laura manages a grocery store while her husband works at a local factory. They are a very close couple and both of them contribute to the household expenses. Laura and her husband have two young children who are in school. She has taken a previous loan with FVP and has demonstrated that she has an excellent payment record.

On this occasion, she needs a loan to invest in her business. She wants to buy more groceries in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to increase her sales

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena E. sells fried doughnuts at Elmina. Abena has been educated up to the senior high level. She is married and has seven dependents. She has been in this business for quite some time now. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save up and begin baking bread.

loans.use: buy more ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Juana Paula tiene 58 años, su actividad es la venta de refrescos, hace más de 8 años que dedica a este negocio. Por lo que sus inicios, se dan porque tenía una gran demanda de sus clientes por lo que en su cuadra nadie vendía de estos productos fue así que decide establecer este negocio en su vivienda. Juana es una mujer muy emprendedora por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mantener a su familia. Este crédito es para la compra de azúcar, bolsas, pajillas, frutas y otras cosas. Sueña con establecer una pulpería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana Paula is 58 years old. She has sold soft drinks for more than 8 years. She started her business after she noticed the great demand and no one in the neighborhood the products. To fill this need she set up a business in her home. Juana is a very enterprising person and she is always looking for a way to support her family. This loan will be used to purchase sugar, plastic bags, straws, fruits and other merchandise. She dreams of having a general store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital.

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en: Grigor K. is married with two little children. He has been managing his business since 2005. The family lives with Grigor’s pensioner parents. Grigor sells shoes from a rented trading booth in Malatia market. The household’s main income comes from this business. Grigor has applied for this loan in order to purchase new shoes for his inventory.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson, D. 27 años, vive en casa D. sus padres en compañía D. ellos, D. su esposa Ana D. 22 años, que trabaja como obrera en una fábrica y D. su pequeña hija, juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. DesD. hace 10 años, este trabajador hombre esta dedicado al rubro D. transporte y en L. actualidad se desempeña como cobrador D. una línea D. transporte público D. su zona. Esta muy satisfecho con su trabajo ya que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ofrecer a su familia una adecuada  calidad D. vida y le gusta pues se entretiene cobrando los pasajes a los usuales pasajeros, pero lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces algunos D. ellos no quieren pagar el precio real y tiene algunos inconvenientes. Trabaja durante 4 días a L. semana desD. las 5 D. L. mañana hasta las 9 D. L. noche, y descansa los fines D. semana, además tiene planeado convertirse en chofer, ya que sabe manejar y quiere aumentar sus ganancias. También quiere instalar una tienda D. comestibles en su casa, y por esta razón es que empezará a acondicionar un espacio para dicha tienda. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con sus cuotas pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Nelson tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en restaurar una pieza D. su casa, para esto mandará a cambiar el techo, ya que presenta algunos agujeros y D. esta manera empezará a instalar un negocio D. venta D. comestibles.
texts.en:
Nelson is 27 years old. He, his wife Ana, 22, and their little daughter, live in his parents' house. She works in a factory.   Since he was 10 years old, this hardworking man has dedicated himself to the transport business.  At the moment, he works as a conductor  on one of the area's public transport lines.  He is very happy with his work, since he receives a regular income, which allows him to offer his family an adequate quality of life.  He enjoys taking payment from his regular customers, although he doesn't like it when people don't want to pay the actual price and cause trouble.  He works four days a week from 5 am to 9 pm and rests on the weekends.  In the future, he hopes to turn himself into a driver, since he knows how to drive and wants to increase his income. He also wants to install a grocery story in his home, and for this reason, he has begun to prepare a space for this shop.

This is his second loan with microfinance partner MFP, and he promises to pay his installments promptly.  The loan will allow him to keep working to better his conditions.  Nelson plans to invest the funds in restoring part of his house.  He needs to change the roof, which already has some holes in it, and thereby start preparing his home for his grocery store business.

loans.use: To restore the roof of his house and to install a shop in it.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
The young woman in the photograph is Ly S., age 31, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, the best territory for farming. 

Ly S. is a married woman who is devoted to her three young children, who attend school and depend on her care. Her husband also helps her in the same business. 

Ly S. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. 

She planted rice and vegetable crops over two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because of their farm is outside of a watering system. So, Ly S. would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation, and the rest of the funds to purchase a sack of fertilizer for her vegetables.

loans.use: To buy a pump for irrigation.

loans.name: Las Flores De Atotonilco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LAS FLORES DE ATOTONILCO porque a la presidenta le gustan mucho las flores y también al grupo en general, este grupo está ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo y tiene 9 integrantes. La señora Teresa A. H.  es integrante del grupo, tiene 37 años de edad, estudió hasta secundaria, su estado civil es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, la señora se dedica a la venta de tortillas negocio que inicio hace 7 años solicita el prestamo para mejorar su negocio y posteriormente con sus ganancias darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: This group is named LAS FLORES DE ATOTONILCO (THE FLOWERS OF ATOTONILCO) because the president of the group likes flowers a lot and the rest of the members, in general, likes them as well. This group is located in the state of Hidalgo and has nine members. Teresa A. H. is a member of the group. She is 37 years old. She went to school until secondary school. She is a single mother and she has a 12 year old son. Teresa sells tortillas. She started this business seven years ago. She is requesting a loan to improve her business and to subsequently give her family a better quality of life with her profits.

loans.use: to improve her business

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SR. DE TAYANCANI”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Ines; La socia es casada y tiene  3 hijas ella se dedica a la venta de comidas y a preparar empanadas, la socia prepara diferentes platos de comidas y las vende en forma ambulatoria, ella elabora sus platos típicos caseros y sus empanadas para vender, ella lleva a vender en forma ambulatoria, la socia cocina muy rico y la gente del pueblo la conoce y le compra sus platos a menudo, ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos, la socia comprara harina, maíz, aceite, papas y algunos productos más. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar sus comiditas caseras y las empanadas e incrementar sus ganancias.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “SR. DE TAYANCANI”. The bank is located in the Ocongate district, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis and the departament of Cuzco.

The member is Maria Ines. She is married and has 3 daughters. She sells meals and makes empanadas. She prepares different dishes and sells them as a street vendor. Her cooking is very delicious and the people in town know her and buy her food often. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying ingredients to make her homemade dishes and empanadas to increase her earnings.  

The member is grateful for and values the loan made to her in this way and she is committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy ingredients to make her home cooked meals and empanadas and increase her earnings.

loans.name: Mrs. Naem Nut Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan in Praveakney village, Takeo province consists of 15 people who have selected Mrs. Naem N. T. be the village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes T. improve their famiL. living. Mrs. Naem N. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land T. grow rice and vegetables T. sell T. support her famiL.. She breeds some chickens, too. In the crop field, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. So T. improve production, Mrs. Naem N. is seeking a loan T. buy fertilizer, rice seed, and some chickens. With the rest of the loan, she is going T. buy some piglets for breeding T. start a new business. She is a widow with two children are both construction workers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and chickens

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est constitué de 8 femmes toutes mariées qui vivent avec leur mari et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Timbabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le commerce de bétail, des céréales et de volailles.                                                                                  
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                                    
MAGNINI C., qui est un ses membres du groupe,  s’approvisionne en volailles avec les éleveurs du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village et pendant les jours de foires au marché de Dioïla,  en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of 8 women who live with their husbands and children in traditional families in the village of Timbabougou, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have an average age of 42, an average of 4 children and all know each other through family and neighbourhood ties. Their business is in cattle, cereals and poultry.
The women of the Benkadi group are on their first solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso.
Magnini C., one of the group members, sources her poultry from farmers in the village and the surrounding areas. She makes her sales in the village and, on fair days at the market in Dioïla, she sells for cash and credit to customers made up of retailers and consumers.
She plans to make a monthly profit of 25,000 XOF, which she will use to repay the loan, to cover healthcare and school expenses and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of poultry

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey Y. is from the town of Banga. He is 40 years old and single. To make a living, Rey owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rey wishes to be a successful businessman.

Rey joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rey is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Theresa Cherop

texts.en:
Theresa Messes is 49 years old and married to Joseph Singoei, a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged 17 years and 14 years old. Theresa runs a cereals shop in Kaboen trading centre in Kapsabet town. She sells maize, beans and cow peas. She has been primarily in this business for a period of five years and her monthly profits is KES 15,000. 

She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more assorted cereals so as to improve her business. She has borrowed a loan of KES 45,000 from KADET LTD this being her fourth loan and she successfully completed her previous loans. She will use this amount to purchase maize for resale KES 30,000 and tea leaves for KES 15,000. Her future hopes and dreams is to expand her business and also educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: Purchase assorted cereals to sell.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is a 37-year-old married man living in Hioma, Uganda. 

He is a teacher and has been teaching for seven years.

He is the sole breadwinner, and his dream is to begin an additional income-generating activity for the family.   

Deus needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter E. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Peter has a cosmetic shop, which he has had for four years.  He also has a second business selling shoes.  

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Peter hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Peter hopes to be able to educate his children up to university and also expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally V. is from the village of Banga, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 53 years old. Sally is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living, Sally owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, candies & eggs in the local community. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Sally joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Sally from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a business buying and selling used clothes for 20 years. Imelda has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy bundles of used clothes for her business. In the future, Imelda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a construction worker.  He works on the other side of the green line. Jihad had to stop work there during the time that Palestinians were not allowed in and this led him to borrow money from his brothers to cover his family and household expenses.

Now that Jihad has a permit to work there again  he took out a loan from FATEN to repay his brothers and have a monthly repayment for FATEN only.

Jihad appears in the picture here

loans.use: to pay back his brothers for the money he borrowed.

loans.name: Huth

texts.en:
Huth H. is a 43 year-old village woman wH. lives in Siem Reap province. She has tried her utmost to earn money by changing many occupations in order to make money.  In the past, she caught fish.  Now she runs a small business selling various goods at a wooden kiosk in her community.  Her husband is a fisherman wH. works along Tunle Sap River. They are blessed with six children.  Two are married and the other four are single. One of them assists with her business. 

Because of her smart management, Huth H. has increased the number of new clients coming to buy her products.  She has planned to grow her inventory.  Huth H. would like to borrow funds from Kiva in order to purchase extra goods in larger amounts than before so that she can satisfy both old  and new customers.

loans.use: to purchase extra goods to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, and beverages in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Perla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Perla is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and beverages. This loan will be Perla's fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and beverages

loans.name: San Miguel Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “San Miguel Juntos Podemos” conformado por 17 emprendedores que se desempeñan en los rubros de amasandería, venta de alimentos, abarrotes, ropa y celulares, principalmente sus negocios se encuentran en una feria libre. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Puente Alto, ciudad de Santiago. 
Elizabeth, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al fondo del grupo, viste una polera color blanco a rayas y usa anteojos. Se dedica a la producción y venta de pan amasado, desde hace 1 año y 6 meses. Vende pan amasado en su misma casa y para la cocción del pan cuenta con un horno de tambor a leña.
Elizabeth trabaja todos los días en éste negocio a partir de las 2ºº de la tarde, hasta las 9ºº de la noche.
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en supermercados mayoristas.
Con el préstamo comprará materiales para fabricar un horno nuevo para la cocción de su pan. Éste lo pondrá en el patio de su casa. 
Sus metas son cambiar de rubro e instalar un ciber café junto a su marido como socio. 
Ella vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 10, 7 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños son sacar adelante a su familia y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Su motivación de continuar con el negocio se debe a la flexibilidad en su horario que le permite estar con sus hijos la mayor cantidad de tiempo posible. 
Elizabeth está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, sobre todo por la buena convivencia y confianza experimentada en el grupo y además le sirve como distracción. 
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "San Miguel Juntos Podemos" and comprised of 17 entrepreneurs who are involved in activities such as a bakery, food, groceries, clothing and cell phones sales.  They all belong to the Puente Alto community in the city of Santiago.  Elizabeth, who is pictured standing standing in the back, is dressed in a white, striped top and wearing glasses,   She makes and sells bread and has been in business for a year and six months.  She has a firewood oven in her house where she bakes the bread.  She works every day from 2:00 p.m. until 9:00 p.m.  She usually buys her supplies in wholesale supermarkets.  With the loan she plans to buy materials to make a new bread-baking oven.  She will set it up in the patio of her house.  Her goal is eventually to change business and set up a cybercafé with her husband as a partner.

She lives with her husband and three children, ages 10, 7 and 2.  Her dream is to see her family get ahead and lead a better lifestyle.  She is motivated by the fact that she has a flexible work schedule which allows her to spend more time with her children.  

Elizabeth is very grateful to Fondo Esperanze and she enjoys participating in the meetings, especially because of the fellowship and confidence she has in the group.  Puento Alto is a community north of Santiago, the capital of Chile.  It was founded as a small rural village at the end of the XIX Century, but due to demographic expansion is one of the most populated communities in Chile, with more than 600,000 inhabitants.  It is the entranceway into the Andean foothills in the metropolitan area known as Cajón del Mapio, which has many trails, routes, rafting and other activities as well as accommodation and food services.

loans.use: To buy materials to make a new oven to bake bread.

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es: Heidy, de 23 años, es una joven muy amable y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Jorge de 23 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Estefano de 1 y José de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de venta de ropa de Heidy esta ubicado en el asentamiento humano Alana Sisley, ella vende jeans, polos, vestidos, para todas las edades y es una de las vendedoras más solicitadas en su barrio, ya que los novedosos modelos que tiene en stock y los precios  accesibles que brinda a sus clientes, la han hecho muy conocida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar sus clientes sobre los modelos que mejor les quedaran, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es traer la ropa desde la ciudad de Lima, ay que es ahí donde mejores modelos consigue en prendas. En adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y pueda mejorar su tienda de ropa. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para desarrollar su negocio, En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de socias, ya que es muy alegre. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para tener más mercadería para vender.
texts.en:
23 year-old Heidy is a very kind and hard-working young woman who lives in her parents' home together with her husband, 23 year-old Jorge, and her two beloved children, 1 year-old Estefano and 4 year-old José, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  

Heidy's clothes business is located in the Alana Sisley [informal] settlement.  She sells jeans, tops and dresses for all ages and is one of the most popular saleswomen in her neighborhood.  The new designs that she has in stock and the affordable prices that she provides her customers with have made her very well known.

What Heidy most enjoys about her work is advising her customers about which designs will suit them best.  She has been in this business for two years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her clothes from the city of Lima as this is where she gets the best designs.  In the future, she hopes that her business will grow and that she will be able to improve her clothes store.

This will be Heidy's first loan from MFP and she hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in developing her business.  Heidy is a very well-liked member of her community bank as she is very cheerful.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more clothes so that she has more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to meet her customer demand

loans.name: Juliebeth

texts.en:
Juliebeth is 41 years old and married with two children.

Juliebeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Juliebeth has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dried fish vending for eight years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Juliebeth aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 39 years old and has four daughters. Thu earns an income to support her family by running a general store. Her husband is a driver. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thu would like to take a loan to expand her shop by purchasing more products such as confectioneries, snacks and beverages to satisfy her customers.

Thu hopes that through the loan, she will be abL. to generate additional income to provide a secure future for her family and send all her daughters to school.

loans.use: to pay for stock such as confectioneries for her general store.

loans.name: Clelia

texts.es: Clelia tiene 32 años de edad convive con Joner de 32 años con quien tiene 2 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Clelia es una mujer muy emprendedora, que se dedica trabajando en una clínica y paralelo a ello posee una botica la cual administra, negocio que poco apoco esta emergiendo y compitiendo con otras. Ella de pequeña creció en el campo, pero tuvo que abandonar la tierra que lo vio nacer para poder estudiar  y ser lo que ahora es, una técnico en enfermería. Clelia se siente feliz por tener un trabajo donde día a día atiende a muchos pacientes y en las tardes trabaja en su propia botica. Ambos trabajos es fruto de muchos años de sacrificio, pues nada es imposible si uno tiene las ganas de superarse. Este es  su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles ella desea adquirir más medicamentos para abastecer su botica.
texts.en:
Clelia, 32, lives with Joner, 32, and their two children.  They live in a house of their own located in the Pichari district.  Clelia is a very enterprising woman who works in a clinic but at the same time has a pharmacy that she runs, a business that is gradually emerging and competing with others.

When she was a little girl she grew up in the countryside but had to abandon the land of her birth to be able to go to school and become what she is today, a technician in nursing.

Clelia feels happy for having a job where she cares for many patients day to day and in the afternoons she works in her own drug store.  Both jobs are the result of many years of sacrifice for nothing is impossible if one has the desire to get ahead.

This is her first loan with MFP and she commits to repay on time.  She will use the 3000 new soles to buy more medicine to stock her drug store.

loans.use: to buy medicine to stock her pharmacy.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 37-year-old rice-growing farmer, she is a widow with three children. She has been growing rice for three years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

She will use the anticipated profit from the business as working capital. Her hopes and dream are to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan produces and sells furniture. He needs some new instruments to increase the quality of furniture. With the help of this loan, Vardan will be able to meet his clients' demand, as well as attract new clients. He will increase his working capital and develop his business further. This means a brighter future for Vardan and his family. Vardan lives with his wife and small child.

loans.use: to pay for an instrument

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman is from the village of Gantiadi, South Georgia. He is 27-years-old and lives with his wife Khatuna and their children – a 6-year-old daughter and three sons, are ages 4, 3, and 1. 

Agriculture is the only source of income for the family. They own a small dairy farm with two milk cows and 1.5 hectares of land where potatoes are grown. They sell milk to local dairy product retailers and the potatoes are sold in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). 

Murman requests a loan to pay for harvesting and transporting the potatoes. He will pay the owner of a tractor to help him harvest and a truck driver to  take them to his store house. 

Also part of the loan (approximately 45%) will be used for purchasing wood for the oven during the winter. The oven is the only means of heating the house in Murman’s village. 

Murman worked hard all year and the weather conditions were favorable so he will have a good harvest. He hopes to sell it for a good price and make a good profit for the well-being of his four children.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting and transporting potatoes for selling, and to purchase wood for heat in the winter.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
El señor Avelino tiene 53 años de edad, es oriundo de la ciudad de Roque González está casado hace más de 32 años con Señora Petrona de 52 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos juntos, 2 en edad escolar y 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y gracias a sus padres ya son todos profesionales.
Hace 20 años empezó con una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, donde la Señora atendía mientras él se dedicaba a comprar animales para faenarlo y luego vender la carne en la despensa. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando la familia junta en la despensa, ya que es el centro de compra más importante y concurrida  de la ciudad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas y artículos de primera necesidad como harina, yerba, fideos y arroz en cantidad, ya que el mismo le servirá para abastecer su local y de esa forma cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Avelino is 53 years old and comes from the city of Roque González. He has been married to Petrona, aged 52, for more than 32 years, and together they have five children, 2 who are school-age and 3 who are grown. Thanks to their parents, they are all professionals.  

20 years ago he opened a small store in his house where his wife works while he buys animals to slaughter and later he sells the meat in the store. Currently the family is working together in the store since it is the most important and busy shopping center in the city. 

He is asking for a loan to buy beverages and essential items like flour, herbs, noodles, and rice in quantity since that will allow him to supply his store and satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages and essential items.

loans.name: Nenneh

texts.en:
Nenneh is 33 years old and married with two children, ages 4 and 14, both attending school. Nenneh runs a kitchen items shop in Goderich, located in the Western Area of Sierra Leone. She has been in this business for 7 years, and has 1 employee working for her. Her family also receives income from her husband’s job at a local company. She says that the main challenge to her business is lacking financial resources to improve her shop. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plastic plates, baskets, buckets, tables, utensils, and other kitchen items. Nenneh says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's welfare. In the future, she would like to open more branches at different locations.

loans.use: to buy plastic plates, chairs, tables, dinnerware, and baskets

loans.name: Marisol Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Marisol del Socorro  de  29  años de edad, labora como docente, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que asume los gastos familiares pues trabaja como técnico metodólogo. Marisol  solicita su 5to   crèdito para mejorar su vivienda reparando una pared que esta en mal estado. Esta docente es muy responsable, honesta y bien luchadora, es bien querida en su comunidad por ser muy responsable con su trabajo; su mayor anhelo  en la vida es que su familia goze de mejores condiciones y por ende mucha salud y que están siempre unidos.
texts.en:
Marisol del Socorro, 29, works as a teacher.  Her husband supports her taking care of household expenses since he works as a methodology technician. 

Marisol is requesting her fifth home improvement loan to repair a wall that’s in poor condition.  She is a very responsible, honest and dedicated teacher who is well liked in her community because she’s very responsible with her work.  Her greatest hope in life is that her family enjoys better conditions and thus good health and that they always stay together.

loans.use: to do home improvements.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman with 2 children, both currently enrolled in school. Florence has operated a local café for the past 4 years and her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be fire outbreaks and her highest monthly expense is food. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Florence will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase wheat flour, oil, salt and other cooking supplies for her cafe. Florence aspires to invest more in her business and eventually purchase a plot to build her own house. She joined Yehu because of the many small-scale loans they have available.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, oil, salt and other cooking supplies.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is from the village of Capellan, in the province of Isabela. She is 48 years old. Teodora is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Teodora owns and operates specialized retail store. She sells a variety of products and fruits in the local community. Teodora has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately P4,200 a month.

Teodora is requesting a new loan of P 24,000 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods, canned goods and drinks.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, canned goods, spices and drinks

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a proud mother of two: Heidi Rose, 25 years old, who is a graduate of Bachelor of Science in Information Technology; and Jomar, 27 years old, who is a Commerce graduate and is already working. Her husband Lucinano has worked as a company driver for 30 years. Rose, as she is fondly called, is very proud that through their income, she and Lucinano were able to send their children to school and finish their studies. Their family has been living in the village for 30 years.

Rose is presently engaged in the personal purchase business. She would like to borrow a loan of 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which she will use to pursue her plan of renovating her business. She wants to maintain this type of business because she believes that personal purchase is a good business if managed well. She wants to improve it, for it will help her family and children when they decided to get married. She is also encouraging her relatives and neighbors to start small businesses.

loans.use: To buy lotion, shampoo, soap, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is married and has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She has been running a grocery store for the past eight years. Her business is faced with the problem of increased price of goods. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to add stock to her store. She looks forward to expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To add stock to her grocery shop.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
This is Nerissa, 47, a resident of Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ulysses, a local Official, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nerissa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighbourhood customers. It is the place to go to buy a container of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Nerissa earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every day.

To help her to continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Nerissa hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to send her children to college. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products that she sells in her business.

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta. Group

texts.en:
Paulina is in her late thirties and is married with three children who go to school. She has been a food vendor and sold quarried stone for two years now. She works from 6.00am to 10.00pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Paulina’s fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.   She used the previous loan to increase the stock in her food vendor business and to pay school fees for her children. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy kitchen utensils and stock her food business.  Paulina’s dream is to one day be able to buy land and build her own house.

Paulina will share this loan with her loan group, "Wazo Tegeta", which has a total of 17 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase food stock and quarried stone.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a 27-year-old single man. He has been in the farming business for the past two years, earning a monthly income of Kes 5,000 which he uses to cater to his basic needs. 

Kenneth is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  He will use the loan to buy a pig and pig feed.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy seedlings for his farm. His hopes and dreams are to save and continue with his  education.

loans.use: buy a pig and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the initial payments on a new mototaxi.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 47-year-old woman with three children, one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling a variety of cold drinks. Her husband is a mechanic. 

For the past twenty years, Ngoc has run a drinks stall to cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy ingredients to make her own drinks as well as to purchase many other kinds of soft drinks to sell to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make her own drinks as well as to purchase many other kinds of soft drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Bougoura, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz et l’arachide  avec  NANA,  1 ere  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles  et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 225.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Benkadi 3" are married women averaging 30 years of age and four children each all living in traditional families in Bougoura, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the wet season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crops grown are rice and peanuts, as is the case with NANA, the first one seated from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, seeds, and sundry farm equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 1.5 hectares.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women.

She expects to make an average profit of 225,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs, sundry equipment, and some seeds

loans.name: Ryakasinga Che School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Polly. He is the Deputy Head Teacher of Ryakasinga CHE School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kabwohe in Sheema with 800 students. Ryakasinga CHE School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Ryakasinga CHE School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Polly ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en: K. is married with 2 children and she is 26 years old. She started her business in 2002. She buys bales of used shoes from Mombasa and Nairobi then, sells to retailers. She sells 4 bales per day and makes profit of about USD 100-170. However, this will increase when all items are bought from Mombasa. She will be earning about USD200 per day.

loans.use: Kemunto wants to increase her capital base in order to have the capacity of buying in bulk from Mombasa where bales of shoes are relatively cheaper.

loans.name: Magdalene Mah

texts.en:
Magdalene is married with three children. Painful memories of her inability to buy medication for herself and her kids motivated her to take the first investment loan of $40 from GHAPE in 2003.  Her immediate goal is to raise money for medication and tuition for her children’s education. Her dream is to raise her own capital and stop greatly depending on loans. With her second and third loans she succeeded in providing fast food, manure, and meat to her community.

Given her experience in cooked food and pig-farming  and the demand for these services, with a loan of $500 she plans to expand her restaurant and piggery with food-flask, pots, plates, cups, 3 piglets, pig-feed and medication, sticks to increase the size of her fence, and to set aside money for transportation. With increased stock she will provide restaurant services, manure, meat and temporary employment to her community.

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Selling snacks & palm wine, and pig & crop cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
"My daughter and I have more than 3 years in the paper business. I'm requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 USD to buy more merchandise and to buy a copier as well. I would like to put together back-to-school packages with school supplies to sell at reasonable prices. I want to make more money to support my family."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo mas de 3 años con el negocio de papelería en el trabajamos mi hija y yo. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls. Para la compra mercancía y una copiadora, en este regreso a clases quiero hacer paquetes de artículos escolares para vender a un buen precio y así tener mas ingreso a la familia.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise and a copier

loans.name: Eudelio

texts.es:
Eudelio C. is a single man, age 46, and he lives with his parents and his two children, who attend school. The older is 11 years old, and in addition to studying he helps his father with the business in his spare time.

Eudelio has his own home and has owned a brick factory for 25 years. He inherited the business from his father, and he has all the necessary equipment, such as mixing machines, wood tables, four molds and an oven with a capacity of 15,000 bricks. He has a great number of customers, and in recent months there has been a considerable increase in the demand for his products.

He needs this loan to buy large quantities of firewood, and in this way increase his production to be able to meet all the demand.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Eudelio C. es un hombre de 46 años, soltero, y vive con sus padres y dos hijos suyos que van a la escuela, el mayor tiene once años y además de estudiar ayuda a su padre en su negocio en sus tiempos libres.

Eudelio tiene casa propia y posee una fábrica de ladrillos desde hace 25 años; el negocio lo heredo de su padre y tiene todo el equipamiento necesario como máquinas amasadoras, mesa de madera, cuatro moldes y un horno con capacidad para 15.000 ladrillos. Posee una gran cantidad de clientes, y en los últimos meses tuvo un aumento considerable en la demanda de sus productos.

Necesita el préstamo para comprar grandes cantidades de leñas, de esta forma aumentar su producción para poder abastecer todas sus demandas.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of firewood

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata is 47 years old and has seven children. She has a grocery store that she put in her house 4 years ago. With her loan she wants to supply the business with a variety of products such as sugar, soap, pasta, oil, candy, drinks, etc. She is part of the group called Alvaro Obregón 2 together with Cristina Elizabeth Guillen Hernández (who sells clothing). Cristina, with her part of the loan, will buy a supply of clothing to display for the women of the community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

FORTUNATA tiene 47 años, siete hijos. Ella cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes que instalo en su casa hace cuatro años, con su préstamo quiere surtir el negocio con una variedad de productos tales: azúcar, jabón, pastas, aceite, dulces, bebidas, etc. Forma parte del grupo llamado Álvaro Obregón 2 junto con doña Cristina Elizabeth Guillen Hernández (venta de ropa). Cristina con la parte que le corresponde del préstamo comprara un surtido de ropa para exhibir con las señoras de la comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase grocery store inventory and clothing

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is very optimistic, despite the fact that he has been seriously ill during recent months and has had to undergo surgery. He has bounced back as if nothing happened, and he gets on with daily life, which he enjoys in the company (and under the watchful eye) of his dear wife.

After making a decision to bring up four children, they worked tirelessly to provide for their children so that they would get on well in their community, and attain each and every one of their goals. Now, in their senior years, they can take great satisfaction in seeing the fruits of their sacrifices and constant imparting of values - their children have grown into good men and women who in turn provide for the families that they have decided to create.

Now that his work as a father is completed, Juan’s strength has been renewed and he has a new goal: to continue working, alongside his wife, to enjoy his grandchildren and have a better quality of life and health. With this goal in mind, they decided two years ago to start raising guinea pigs. In earlier years they had practiced agriculture, but due to the physical effort involved and for health reasons, they had to give it up and sell all their plots of land, so that they could devote themselves entirely to this new business venture.

Day by day they wait for their guinea pigs to grow, watching the fruits of their investment with satisfaction. In order to house the new members of this small business, they plan to improve the facilities of their farm and become better prepared in order to obtain better results. That is why they are asking for a loan to invest in alfalfa and construction tools to start their expansion project as soon as possible. Let’s support this couple, who are a fine example of the family strength. Your contribution is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

Juan, es una persona muy optimista, a pesar de que su vida ha estado en riesgo durante estos meses por su estado de salud y tuvo que ser intervenido quirúrgicamente; se levanta como si nada hubiese pasado y ejerce sus actividades diarias porque tiene el gusto de hacerlas en compañía y bajo la fiel mirada de su querida esposa.

Desde que decidieron cobijar a cuatro hijos en el seno de su hogar han trabajado denodadamente a fin de brindarles lo necesario para que se desenvuelvan sin dificultad dentro de su sociedad y puedan alcanzar todas y cada una de las metas que se proponen.Ahora, ancianos observan con M. satisfacción los frutos de su sacrificio y constante comunicación de valores ya que se han convertido en hombres y mujeres de bien y además sostienen decorosamente a la familia que han decidido constituir.

Teniendo en cuenta que su labor de padre ha concluido, cada una de sus fuerzas se han renovado y tienen un nuevo propósito, continuar con su desempeño laboral al lado de su esposa para disfrutar de sus nietos y elevar su calidad de vida y salud. Con este propósito en mente se animaron hace dos años a dedicarse a la crianza de cuyes, años atrás se dedicaban a la agricultura pero por razones físicas y se salud tuvieron que abandonarlas y vender cada una de sus parcelas para dedicarse enteramente a esta nueva ocupación.

Día a día están pendientes del crecimiento de sus cuyes y con este nuevo oficio observan con satisfacción los frutos de su inversión.Y para albergar a los nuevos miembros de su pequeño negocio planean mejorar las instalaciones de su granja y capacitarse más a fin de obtener mejores resultados; es por ello que solicitan un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de alfalfa y demás implementos de construcción para poner en marcha su proyecto de expansión en corto tiempo.Apoyemos a esta pareja, ejemplo de la solidez familiar; tu aporte es muy importante.

loans.use: To buy food and refurbish facilities for rearing guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ai

texts.en: Ai J. is a 38-year-old woman who owns a small grocery store selling rice, snacks, vegetables, etc. She usually earns US$17 a week, while her husband Mad Sari does not have a permanent job. Ai is asking for a loan to buy various goods for her store. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for a grocery store

loans.name: Shamo

texts.en:
Mr. Shamo is 37, married, with three children. He lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic, in Caucasus region.
Shamo owns a herd of milk cows. Every day he sells milk to the local milk-processing shop. His children help him breed the cows in the nearby grazing area. The income from four cows is too low to support the family. That’s why Shamo applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan, to buy one more pure-bred cow to make his monthly income higher. The price of a milk calf is $300, the cost of breeding is $100. The other $100 he plans to save for unexpected expenditures.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Zafar E. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children. He has college education. He works in GAUP "Tajik Air" as a shooter (she shoots birds so they would not interfere with airplanes). He asks for a credit to fix his house as it is very hard for him to accumulate the needed amount of money on his own. A better way for him is to obtain a loan and repay it using his regular income within 14 months. This will give him an opportunity to fix his house and live in better conditions.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Элодов Зафар Хаетович житель города Душанбе. Возраст 35 лет Женат имеет 2 детей. Образование соредне- техническое. Работает в ГАУП «Таджик Эйр» работает стрелком.(стреляет в птиц , чтобы не мешали самолетам). Запрашивает кредит на ремонт дома, т.к. сам скопить на ремонт он не может , ему удобнее получить кредит и с заработной платы погашатьего в течении 14 месяцев. Это даст возможность ему отремантировать жилье и жить в хороших условиях.

loans.use: To fix the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for the school year

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Mrs. Lorena is 24 years old; she is a single mother and lives in a rented room in the city of La Paz. The business she is in is makeup sales. This was the only source of income she has for herself and her young son, who still goes to school. Today, she would like to expand her market and also sell clothes to her clients, making her dues payable in installments. As far as her payment history, she has demonstrated being a very responsible person; since she began with her loan with our institution, she has not presented any problem making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Lorena tiene 24 años, es madre soltera y vive en una Habitacion alquilada en la Ciudad de La Paz. El negocio al que ella se dedica es el de la venta de cosméticos, esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que tiene para ella y para su pequeño hijo que aun va a la escuela. Ahora ella pretende ampliar su mercado y tambien vender ropa a sus clientes, haciendo que sus pagos sean a plazos. En cuanto a su historial de pago, demostró ser una persona muy responsable, ya que desde que inicio su crédito con nuestra institucion no ha presentado ningun problema en sus pagos.

loans.use: Will purchase clothing to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Alimatou C. was born in Lomé in 1986, in Golfe prefecture. She is single and lives with her mother. She did not have the chance to continue in her studies after earning her primary school diploma. She learned how to sew and today is well-off having her certificate of completion. After her apprenticeship, she began a small 'pagne' cloth business, which enabled her to buy a sewing machine, adding dressmaking to her commerce in pagne cloth.

A determined, energetic, and very self-assured woman, she provides quality service to her customers. To provide this service more effectively where her customers are found, she is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine and to bolster her pagne cloth business. This strategy of adding pagne cloth commerce to her dressmaking will enable her to reach other customers and to make her business profitable. This will allow her to care for and meet the needs of her mother.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mlle C. Alimatou est née à Lomé en 1986 dans la préfecture du Golfe. Elle est célibataire et vit avec sa mère. Elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer ses études après son certificat d’études primaires. Elle a appris la couture et est aujourd’hui nantie d’un certificat de fin de formation. Après son apprentissage, elle a commencé un petit commerce de pagne, ce qui lui a permis d’acheter une machine pour associer le commerce de pagne à la couture. Déterminée, dynamique et très sûre d’elle-même, elle offre un service de qualité à ses clients. Pour rendre ce service plus efficace à l’endroit des clients, elle sollicite un crédit pour s’acheter une autre machine et renforcer son commerce de pagne. Cette stratégie d’associer le commerce de pagne à la couture lui permettra d’atteindre d’autres clientes et de rentabiliser son commerce. Ceci lui permettra de se prendre en charge et assumer les besoins de mère

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and to bolster her pagne fabrics business

loans.name: Anita's Group

texts.en:
Anita and Caridad belong to the Los Jazmines Village Bank in San Juan D. Lurigancho in the east of Lima.

Anita lives with her common-law husband and has 6 children. 4 are over 18 and 2 are school age. She has had a family business making polo shirts for 10 years and sends her clothes to the country for sale.

Caridad is married and has 3 children over 18. She likes weaving bedspreads and blankets and has been weaving for 3 years. Before that, she used to work at home.

Anita and Caridad are soliciting loans of 1600 soles (about US$ 550) and 400 soles (about US$ 150) respectively so as to purchase merchandise so that they can grow their micro-enterprises.

They both want to carry on their businesses to help their families and have an additional income. Anita also would like to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise so that they can grow their micro-enterprises

loans.name: Gulbadan

texts.ru:
Gulbadan Z. lives in the city of Nurek, is married and has six children. She is a housewife. She also raises cattle and sells young calves on the market. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. When she learned about the possibility to obtain a loan, she decided to further develop her business and obtain a loan of $750. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Зухурова Гулбадан проживает в городе Нурек. Замужем , имеет шестерых детей. Домохозяйка . Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот и молодых телят продает на рынке. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Сейчас , узнав о возможности получить кредит , Решила развивать свой бизнес и получить кредит в размере 2500 сомони. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a claf

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат родилась в 1965 году. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Она вот уже 11 лет работает в  ОАО "Точиктелеком" города Вахдат диспетчером. Работая с утра до вечера Сабохат зарабатывает маленькую сумму, которую тратит на питание семьи. Ее муж работает по найму и тоже зарабатывает небольшую сумму. Она хочет сделать в доме небольшой ремонт, покрасить стены, починить крышу, подготовится к предстоящей зиме. Узнав о том, что можно получить займ для ремонта дома и постепенно погашать его в течении 10 месяцев Сабохат решила участвовать в программе Кива. Она хочет получить сумму 1500 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sabohat was born in 1965. She is married and has three children. For 11 years, she has worked as an operator for the “Tojiktelecom” company in Vakhdat city. She works from morning to night for a small salary which she uses to feed her family. Her husband takes on odd-jobs also bringing home a small salary. She would like to do small repairs on her home, to paint the walls and fix the roof in preparation for the upcoming winter. Knowing that she could get a loan to repair her home and gradually pay it back over 10 months, Sabohat decided to participate in Kiva's loan program. She would like to take a loan of 1500 somoni for a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Angela P.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Angela C.. She is married and has two children aged 6 and 1. In 2004, Angela established her bicycle spare parts business. Working 7 days a week and 13 - 16 hours a day, she earns about US$ 380 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Angela requires a loan in order to purchase more spare parts in bulk. In the future, Angela plans to expand and establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment--a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emiliano tiene 39 años, y una esposa muy colaboradora, que lo apoya en los trabajos del campo. Esta pareja ha tenido 5 hijos que en este momento están en la etapa de colegio.  Se dedica con su esposa. a la agricultura desde muchos años atrás, para ellos es su fuente de ingreso, le gusta que su tierra esté bien trabajada, siembra 50 sacos de semilla de papa y no descuida ninguna de sus chacras sembradas, asimismo sembró arvejas, y habas.   Su esposa y sus 5 hijos trabajan para sus ingresos diarios; de los cuales el mayor tiene 20 años, quien le ayuda fielmente al cuidado de los cultivos, y después tiene que ir a estudiar.  Como tiene ya sembradas sus tierras, necesita de un capital para que abone sus cultivos y así cosechar y cotizar un buen precio en el mercado. Lo que más le incomoda es el precio muy elevado del abono, que lo que tiene no le alcanza.  Emilio trabaja para  solventar los estudios de sus 3 menores hijos, de los 5 que tuvo.   Con el préstamo,  invertirá en la compra de abono para su chacra de papas.  Su anhelo, con el tiempo, es de sembrar en mayores cantidades, y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emilio is 39 years old and has a very collaborative and supportive wife who joins him in tending to their crops. This couple has 5 children who are all in school. He and his wife have been working in agriculture for many years, it's their livelihood. Emilio likes the earth to be well worked; he plants 50 bags of potato seeds and takes care of all of his cultivated crops, like the arvejas and habas. His wife and 5 children work for the family's daily income; the eldest is 20 years old and helps take care of the crops, but then has to go and study. As Emilio has already planted his land, he needs a loan to fertilize his crops in order to fetch a good price at the market. Unfortunately, fertilizer is expensive and Emilio just can't afford it. Emilio works to pay for the educations of the 3 youngest of his 5 sons. With this loan, he'll buy fertilizer for his potato crop. His goal, with time, is to plant larger quantities and educate his children.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.name: Maritza Irene

texts.es: La Sra. Maritza Zacarias es cliente nuestra desde el año 2007, se dedica a la producción de chompas de hilo las cuales vende por docena a las comerciantes de la calle Tumusla, un mercado de ropa muy conocido en la ciudad. Es cliente muy responsable en sus pagos y tiene un buen historial crediticio,los creditos que sacó anteriormente fueron para equipar su taller comprando mas maquinaria.La señora Maritza es madre soltera de un niño de 10 años de edad y además mantiene a sus padres quienes son mayores de edad, su actividad le brinda los recursos necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza Zacarias has been a client since 2007. She makes linen sweaters, which she sells by the dozen to vendors on the street Tumusla, where a well-known clothing market is located. She is a very responsible client in terms of her repayments and has a good credit history. Her previous loans were used to stock her workshop by purchasing more machinery. Mrs. Maritza is a single mother of a 10 year old boy. She also supports her parents, who are elderly. Her business allows her to bring in all the necessary resources to pull her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Rosario Cristina

texts.es: La Señorita Rosario Cristina de 24 años de edad, Soltera de oficios Estudiante “Compra y Venta de Ropa Típica para mujeres”, cuentan con un pequeño negocio, desde su niñez se dedicaba al Comercio gracias a los préstamos  a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Chichaclan, Cantón Poxlajuj del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra y venta de ropa típica, dicho Comercio para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosario Cristina is 24 years old and single. She has a small business buying and selling traditional women's clothing. She has worked in this field since she was young, thanks to loans that helped her family get ahead. Rosario lives in the Chichaclan neighborhood of the Poxlajuj district of Totonicapán, Guatemala, and is very well-known there.

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner Asociación ASDIR in order to help her buy and sell traditional clothing. This investment will enable her to successfully meet her clients' demand, and thereby increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy traditonal clothing

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel Vasquez P. is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the eastern jungle region of Peru. Pucallpa is the regional capital of the tropical Amazonian department of Ucayali, which is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River that flows north, meeting up with Amazon and, eventually, flowing into the Atlantic Ocean. Fifty years ago, Pucallpa was a tiny caserío or hamlet; but everything changed when the only paved highway leading into the Amazon region was built and Pucallpa became the gateway to the jungle at the roads’ end.  Since the mid-20th century, the city has sprung up and engulfed the surrounding caserios.  Today the city is a bustling, hot metropolis with immigrants from all over Peru.

Maribel is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Women Entrepreneurs) bank.  She has worked with them and the Manuela Ramos microfinance organization for over four years now.  Maribel first started with loans just under $100, but she has gradually upped her loan amounts to well over $700 now.

Maribel used to sell only shoes for a living, but now as her business has grown she has started to sell clothing and food too.  She is requesting 2,200 Nuevo Soles to be repaid over the course of six months. She will use the loan to purchase chicken, rice,  t-shirts, shoes, and other clothing.

loans.use: To buy chicken, rice,  t-shirts, shoes, and other clothing

loans.name: Martiza Mercedes Viii Group

texts.en:
The Bank of Hope "Maritza Mercedes" is located  in El Seybo. Group 8 has just gotten approval on their third loan. All members of this group will be investing their money directly in merchandise purchases. Sandra M. is the group representative. Her business consists of selling shoes. 

In the future, these micro-entrepreneurs state that they'd love to see better lives for their children, good health-care and education, they'd like to grow their business ventures further, and some would like to continue their own studies (at the secondary and university level). Sandra has set herself the goal of building her own house. 

The picture provided shows these group members gathered at the Esperanza office in El Seybo. 

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchase shoes and sandals

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy L. is a villager in Prey Meas village in Takeo province. She is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Kong Seng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. He faces an obstacle because he usually needs to paya lot of money to plow the field. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Soy L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow the field. She is 45 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed, another stays at home to do housework and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow a rice field.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina A. is fifty-one years old. She is a widow and the mother of three little kids who are in basic school. Augustina lives with her children in a family house in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite a large number of women are involved in palm oil production. Augustina is one of the women who actively produce palm oil. She has been in business for six years. 

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community; processes it in her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the food of the palm fruits. It has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and boiled again to expel water content. Augustina wants to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruits in bulk. She will then be able to increase the number of customers she serves.  She owns a refrigerator and uses it for the sale of sachet water to support her family with additional income.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and, eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Kingdom Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee loans for one another and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To procure palm fruits and sachet water in bulk.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata A. is twenty-six years old and the mother of three children, ages nine, six and three. She sells cereals in the Nyamasaria slum where she lives. She says her dream is to finance her children all the way through college and that she enjoys running her own business. She buys most of her goods from the Kibuye market in downtown Kisumu. Her husband also helps finance things as a tailor. Consolata is asking for $125 to expand her business.

loans.use: Cereals

loans.name: Askarjon

texts.ru: Аскарчон занимается продажей масла на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Он продает хлопковое масло, говяжий жир, растительное масло и сливочное масло. Разные масла он закупает в разных местах. Хлопковое масло он закупает хлопковом заводе, растительное и сливочное масло ему поставляет фирма. А говяжий жир он закупает у мясников. Еще он продает иранские масла "Мумин", которые поставляет та же фирма. Сейчас масла подешевело. И поэтому торговля пошла лучше. Аскарчон планирует расширить свой бизнес и открыть свой магазин.
texts.en:
Askarjon sells oil in Panchshanbe market in Khujand. He sells cottonseed oil, suet, vegetable oil, and butter. He buys different oils in different places. He buys cottonseed oil from a cotton factory; vegetable oil and butter is delivered by another company. And he buys the suet from butchers.
