Additionally, he sells an Iranian oil called "Mumin" which is delivered by the same company. Currently, the price of oil has fallen, and consequently his trade has gotten better. Askarjon plans to expand his business and to open up his own shop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling oil

loans.name: Marie Joy

texts.en:
Marie Joy R. is 22 years old and striving hard to have a progressive life. She and her husband Edgar were gifted with two children. Edmar is 6 years old and Desyrie is 6 months old. Marie Joy's chosen business is vending snacks, such as peanuts, banana cue, and vegetables. She is also a hog raiser in their village.

According to her, all her efforts and sacrifices are for her children. She hopes to give them a progressive life in the future. For her to fulfill her plans, she is requesting a loan for PHP 4,000 for the improvement of her enterprise.

loans.use: To expand her hog raising business.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina S. is from the town of Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Felina is married and has five school-aged children. Felina earns a living by owning and operating a dress-making business. She provides women's tailoring services to local community members. Felina has been engaged in her business for some years now and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Felina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Felina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from GDMPC. Felina is now requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as sewing machines, needles and thread. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Felina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business and to support her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as sewing machines, needles and thread

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
T. Đỗ Thị is 38 years old and lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from this work.

In 2003, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase machinery to expand the business.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese A., 53, is married with ten children. She has many years of experience in her taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village community and to the general public three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). She has three previous loans with SPBD. 

SPBD loans are Akenese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy stuff for her business and also to pay school fees and for home improvement

loans.use: To buy weedkiller, chemicals, knives, a sharpenner, a wheelbarrow and to pay for school fees and home improvement

loans.name: Stinely

texts.en:
Stinely is happily married to Jimbo. They live in a rural place in Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. They have great ambitions for their three children and that is why they strive hard to earn and support their children’s studies.

Stinely manages a general store business while her husband cultivates their farm lot twice a year. She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan from Kiva to use as additional business capital to buy more stock that will definitely increase her daily income. She also plans to purchase ten sacks of rice to retail in her store. She hopes that through their livelihood, they will be able to finance the education of their children.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Саида

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Каримова 1958 года рождения, замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж и сын Каримовой  уехали на заработки в Россию.Она с детство помогала родителям за уходом скота. Теперь она сама занимается откормом скота. У Каримовы есть дойная корова которая приносит ей дополнительную прибыль от продажи молока и сметаны. Она планирует купить  еще корову с телёнком и благодарит кредиторов за финансовую поддержку.

loans.use: На покупку крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Zayas

texts.en:
L. Zayas is from the village of Jasaan , Misamis, Oriental. She is forty-four years old and married with three grown children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling different herbal products and food supplements. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2009, L. joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offerings. L. is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in improving her store. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to further expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr: Aïssata S. est une jeune femme mariée de 34 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine et aimerait renforcer son activité. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.

loans.use: Faire de l'embauche ovine

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Hamidou T. a 34 ans, marié et sans enfant, il réside avec son épouse au quartier Dioulasso de la ville de Kadiolo (dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  T.  fait la commercialisation de  maïs  (graines) il y a environ sept  ans. En plus il gère : une pharmacie vétérinaire, une discothèque et une unité de pondeuses. 
Son magasin  d’achat et de vente de céréales se trouve au marché de la ville de Kadiolo. 
Il sollicite un quatrième prêt individuel  auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, les trois premiers s’étant bien déroulés, pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt,  trois tonnes de maïs  à Kadiolo ville les jours de foire et souvent dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs. Ils sont vendues dans la ville de Kadiolo en gros au comptant les jours de foire à une clientèle composée essentiellement de forains ( venant de Sikasso et d’autres grandes villes). 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 55.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, payer les intérêts de son prêt et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou T. is 34 years old, he lives with his spouse in the neighborhood of Dioulasso in the city of Kadiolo (in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

Mr. T. has done business selling corn (seeds) for about 7 years. Additionally, he manages a veterinary pharamacy, a disco and a hen-laying business. His store is located in the market of the city of Kadiolo.

He is requesting a fourth individual loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy his growing clientele; the first three were fully repaid.

He will use this loan to purchase three tons of corn from Kadiolo on the days of the fair and from the surrounding villages with corn farmers. He sells mostly in the city of Kadiolo for wholesale in cash during the days of the fairs, to a clientele composed largely of fair-goers, coming from Sikasso and other large cities.

He envisions that this loan will enable him to earn a monthly profit of 55,000 FCFA, which he will use mostly to increase the his business' funds, pay the interest on his loan and contribute to his family's expenses.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is again here to request a loan of PHP 7,000 from lenders. She would like to further improve and grow her business which involves retailing and cultivation of vegetables in her backyard. The loan will be used as her additional revolving capital in purchasing more vegetables and fruits to sell. She is also planning to buy more vegetables to plant in her vegetable garden.

Lilibeth and her husband are planning to purchase hogs to raise. They believe that it will help them in time of their need. She hopes that lenders will continuously support her business because it really provides most of their family needs.

Lilibeth is now 23 years old and has two children. Joanna, her eldest is now two years old and her youngest is just one month old. Lilibeth is hoping to give a good future to her children by striving hard to succeed in her business. Her husband who is a painter is very supportive with her business. He cultivates their farm and helps her in her business most of the time.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eva Cayetana

texts.es: La Señorita Eva es originaria de la comunidad de Chuipache lugar muy hermoso por los bosque de San Miguel Totonicapán  su principal fuente de ingreso es la venta y compra y crianza de animales domésticos inicio su propio negocio hace cuatro años  sus principales lugares de ventas  son: Totonicapán, San Francisco el Alto y salcaja Quetzaltenango actualmente necesita de un crédito que le servirá para ampliar su capital y aprovechar la época de fin de año  donde las ventas incrementas y con las ganancias que obtiene le permitirá  mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Eva is from the community of Chuipache, a beautiful place near the forests of San Miguel Totonicapán. Her main source of income is the selling, purchasing and breeding of domestic animals. She started her business 4 years ago and she most of her transactions take place in Totonicapán, San Francisco el Alto and Quetzaltenango. She currently requires a loan, which will help her increase her working capital and take advantage of the end of the year, when sales increase. With the earnings from this she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita V. es madre responsable ya que ha llevado el sustento a sus dos pequeños hijos que estudian en el colegio. Sus pequeños requieren del apoyo de ella para superarse por lo que a diario ella vela por el bienestar de cada uno de ellos.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para el pago de los aranceles escolares ya que le urge hacer tales pagos para permitir que sus pequeños sigan estudiando en el colegio y así contribuir para que en el futuro lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita V. is a responsible mother who has provided for her two small children who are studying in school. Her little ones require support in order to succeed in school, so she sees to the welfare of each one of them daily. The reason that she has approached Ceprodel is to request a loan to pay for school fees, since she must make these payments in order that her children can continue to study at school, so that they can become true professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber es casado, no tiene hijos, trabaja como asesor pedagogico del Ministerio de Educación, esta solicitando su primer crédito  con AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es terminar de construir una habitación, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa la cual trabja como docente, a pesar que no tienen hijos ayudan a sus familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos,  Wilber es un joven con muchos deseos de superación profesional y laboral, actualmente esta estudian su primer año en ciencias de Educación en la Universidad URACCAN , el ha ido poco a poco mejorando su vivienda  desde que la obtuvieron para tener un hogar digno para su familia que cumpla con las condiciones que la familia necesita y su sueño es ser un profesional con mucha experiencia, salud y trabajo
texts.en:
Wilber is married. He does not have children. He works as a pedagogical advisor in the Ministry of Education. He is asking for his first loan with Afodenic to improve his house by finishing the construction of a room. He has his wife’s help. She works as a teacher. In spite of not having children, they help their families because they have scarce economic resources. Wilber is a young man with a great desire for professional and work success. He is currently studying his first year in the science of education in the Uraccan University. He has been improving his house little by little since they got it. He does this to have a decent home with the necessary conditions for his family. His dream is to be a professional with much experience, health, and work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married with a grown daughter. She is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye where she sells jean clothing in Angolenko market. Nadezhda owns a vending kiosk in the central row of the marketplace. Her kiosk stands out as it offers a nice selection of jean clothing items of good quality at reasonable prices. Nadezhda has been n this business for eight years. Presently, she has about 15,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly profit is 2,000 Grivnyas. 

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 12,400 Grivnyas to re-stock the winter clothing assortment that she offers for sale in her vending kiosk. We believe her perseverance, managing skills and enthusiasm will help her achieve her goal and succeed in business.

loans.use: To restock winter clothing

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum C. is an older, widowed mother who has given birth to five children. One of her sons, who is shown in the picture, owns a small machine that he uses to mill rice and bran, which he then sells. He feeds any leftover rice to his pigs. 

Chum C. is 67 and lives in Kampong Chhnag Province where she owns a medium-sized farm. She earns a living from this land by growing a rice crop that she sells and eats. After Chum C. has harvested her rainy-season rice crop and collected the proceeds, she wants to replant a rice crop during the dry season. Due to the lack of capital, Chum C. would like to ask for a Kiva loan that she will buy use to buy fertilizer and seeds for her second crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León, la señora Reyna H. se ha dedicado con mucho esfuerzo a su actividad de crianza de ganado y trabajos agrícolas habiéndose dedicado a estas actividades desde hace mas de 20 años habiendo alcanzado gran experiencia en ello.
Ella es madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que debe de brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de cuatro vaquillas para proceder con su crianza y luego extraerle la leche para comercializarla y es por esta razón que espera confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado y así comprará dichas vaquillas para continuar en su actividad de ganadería y sacarles el máximo provecho.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna H., who lives in the town of El Sauce in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Leon, makes a living raising cattle and doing other farm-related jobs, work she has been doing for more than 20 years. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are still in school, and she owes it to them to create the conditions they need to thrive. She is applying for a loan to buy four heifers that she will raise for a milking business. She hopes to get the loan so that can buy the heifers, continue her livestock business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy four heifers for livestock business.

loans.name: Latifa Lutale ‘S Group

texts.en:
Latifa is 40 years of age, widowed and has twelve children aged between 13 and 19 years. All of her children go to school. The family resides and rents a two roomed house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for children and medication and feeding the family. 

Latifa owns a restaurant in Katanga  selling all types of snacks like chips, chicken, fish, and sausages. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 50 customers a day. Latifa has done this business for over ten years. She incurs transport costs to and from buying food supplies from different markets. Her main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.  She sells on retail basis only.

Latifa has been with MCDT for four years, servicing her fifth loan with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more food supplies like sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking fish, and packets of sausages. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and start doing outside catering.
.

loans.use: To  buy sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil and packets of sausages

loans.name: Wellars

texts.en:
Wellars is 26 years old and is single. He lives with his parents in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Wellars has been a businessman for three years, selling onions, nuts, tomatoes and so on. He has chosen this kind of business because these products are needed by everyone who is going to cook, and they are more profitable than another foodstuffs.

Wellars is a hardworking man, his business is open from eight in the morning to eight in the evening every day. His business is located in the Kimironko market not far from Rwanda’s international airport. Actually, his business is very organized as well as employing one person as a helper so that his business runs well.

Now, Wellars is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more vegetables to attract more customers. With this added attraction, he will be able to obtain more profits which will allow him to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Charbel

texts.en: Charbel has worked as an electrician for the past 15 years. He works on a freelance basis serving homes and shops upon request of his clients. He is well known in his town and the neighboring villages. He is 30 years old, single, and his family's sole provider. Today, Charbel has found an opportunity to expand his business into other areas and take on more projects. To do so, he's asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy new tools instead of the used ones he has now.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Fanny Luz

texts.es:
Fanny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 23 años, ella es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que se las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene un local alquilado cerca a la Plaza Armas del Cusco, donde expende sus productos de platería y ya son dos años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Los ingresos de la socia Fanny fueron afectados por la caída del turismo en la ciudad del Cusco. La poco afluencia de turistas se debe a las fuertes precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron durantes los meses de enero y febrero haciendo que muchos local cerraran por falta de ventas, pero Fanny es una joven impetuosa se sigue adelante a pesar de las adversidades. Fanny usará el préstamo para comprar más platería.  El sueño de la socia es tener su propia  tienda y así de esta manera vender más y tener más ingresos económicos y darse una mejor calidad de vida.    
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the Communal Bank "Sacsayhuaman", which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 23 years old. This hardworking and enterprising young woman managed to open her own business selling handicrafts. She has a rented location near the Plaza Armas in Cusco where she sells products made of silver. Fanny has already been in this business for two years and has done very well because of the effort she puts into her work. Her earnings were impacted by the slump in tourism in the city of Cusco. The lack of tourists that resulted from the heavy rains during the months of January and February caused many businesses to shut down due to a lack of sales. However, Fanny is a determined young woman who pressed forward despite these adversities. She will use this loan to buy more silver. Her dream is to have her own shop so that she can sell more and generate additional income that will provide her a better quality of life.

Fanny is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase silver

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: N. Cissy is a resident of Kawempe Lugoba near St. Mark Clinic. She has a clothing business and she is a farmer in the village. She has been in business for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase clothes (sportswear) from Kampala shops for her shops in Kalerwe. She wants to expand her business of selling sportswear. She is a promising business lady whose dream is traveling to Nairobi to purchase her goods at a subsidized price.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Madiama

texts.fr: Monsieur Madiama D. habite a Yoff mais il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a Ouakam depuis l’année dernière. Il a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur au sein de l’institution.  Il est âgé de 51 ans, marie et père de 2 enfants. Il s’active dans le domaine de l’élevage et du commerce de moutons. Il a une expérience de 7 ans dans cette activité qu’il a choisie par passion  depuis son enfance. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs destine a l’achat de moutons qu’il va revendre. Son premier crédit lui a permis  d’avancer dans ses activités et d’atteindre une capacité de faire face à ses charges  de chef de  famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Madiama D. lives in Yoff, but he has been member of the UIMCEC credit union in Ouakam since last year. He has already benefitted from an earlier loan. He is 51 years old, married and the father of two children. He raises sheep for resale. He has had seven years of experience in this business, to which he has been attracted since childhood. He is seeking a loan of 400,000 West African francs in order to purchase sheep for resale. His previous loan allowed him to grow his business and to achieve a sales volume which is necessary in view of his family responsibilities.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering the business capital

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 26 years old and single. Celestin has a small shop where he sells drinks (beer and Fanta), cooking oil, sardines and so on. Celestin has run this business for three years and his shop is open from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day. Celestin is well-known in the region where his business is located. Celestin employs one person from his community so that his business runs smoothly.

Celestin is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more drinks and other products. With this loan Celestin will be able to attract more customers which will allow him to earn more profits. With the extra money, Celestin expects to get married.

loans.use: Expanding his shop

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a youth, aged 30 years, married to a peasant wife and together they have two children aged 3 years and 1 year and 9 months. His family resides in a rented house in Kagadi, Uganda.

Ibrahim is the income earner for the family. He has a shoe business selling shoes on market days in different areas in his home district. He says his business has grown in size over the six years he has operated it having started as a food seller in the capital, Kampala. He faces a transport problem in his business, though, due to poor roads that are common in the upcountry areas of Uganda.

Ibrahim’s purpose in requesting the loan is to buy secondhand shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand shoes to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma G. is from the village of Bantug. She is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Wilma owns and operates a beauty salon, providing haircutting, hair curling, hair straightening, manicure and pedicure services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her tenth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza D. is from the village of  Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Annaliza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Annaliza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Annaliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Annaliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annaliza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Annaliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Djigui 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Djigui 2 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Gnabourouthila, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide et  le petit mil. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, NANA F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare  de céréales et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35 000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djigui 2 Group are married women who are, on average, 34 years old with 4 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Gnabourouthila, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture in Koulikoro, the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate include, among others, peanuts and pearl millet. They are on their third rural loan, and the previous loans were repaid properly. With this new loan Nana F. (one of the women in the group) intends to buy farming inputs before the prices go up, to purchase small equipment, and to pay for labour costs to maintain about 1.5 hectares of cereal and peanut crops. The products are sold in the city of Dioïla after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. They intend to realize an average profit of 35,000 FCFA at the end of the term.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy faming inputs, purchase small equipment, and pay for manual labour

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 54 years old and is married. She struggles in selling a variety of foodstuffs, mainly cassava flour, corn flour, rice, sugar, etc. This is her fifth successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Despite five years of experience in the business, Constance's capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, with the result that her profits are still too low. To end this, she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.

Once given this loan, Constance will expand her business through purchasing additional foodstuffs to sell. With these additional foodstuffs, her sales as well as her profits will increase. Thus, she will also be able to improve the living style of her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials (tin roofing, cement, wood, bolts)

loans.name: Villa Universitaria Group

texts.es:
El Comité Villa Universitaria de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones se dedican al comercio, venta de ropas, comidas, empleadas domésticas, almaceneras y otros.
Se encuentran actualmente en el 12° ciclo, permaneciendo en el grupo se han beneficiado con el crédito, la consulta oftalmológica y las capacitaciones de la institución.  
Se encuentran motivadas y desean seguir trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya y gozar de los beneficios que ofrece el programa.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Ana que tiene un despensa donde ofrece productos de la uso domestico especialmente para la alimentación y para limpieza.
Comenta que tiene muchos clientes y que va muy bien con su negocio, además de su negocio ella también cuenta para la alimentación de la familia con cría de animales y producción de verduras y frutas.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como fideos, azúcar, aceite, enlatados, panificados, jabones y otros.
texts.en:
The “Villa Universitaria” (University Village) committee of the city of San Ignacio Misiones is dedicated to commerce: to the sale of clothing and food, to being domestic employees, storekeepers and others. They are currently in their 12th cycle. By staying in the group they have benefitted from credit, eye clinic consults and training workshops provided by the Institution. They are motivated and want to continue collaborating with Fundación Paraguaya enjoying all the benefits that the program offers. One of the members is Ana who has a grocery store where she stocks home use items, especially food and cleaning supplies.She comments that she has many customers and she does well with her business. In addition to her store she also raises small farm animals and grows fruits and vegetables for her family’s nutritional needs. She is asking for funding to buy stock items for her store like: pasta, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, baked goods, soaps and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta, sugar, cooking oil, rice, baked goods, dairy products and others.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La Sra. Leonarda S. es comerciante hace cinco años, tiene una despensa en su  domicilio en el Barrio Virgen de Fátima,  de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
 Esta casada con el Sr. Pedro Vázquez hace 21 años, tienen 5 hijos juntos: Nestor 21 , Pedro 17, Fátima 10, Rosio 9, Alexis 10 meses.
Su negocio es muy importante por que es la entrada principal de la familia para el sustento de la misma, además comenta que comenzó con un pequeño kiosko y de a poco fue creciendo y a la vez le ayudo a dar el beneficio a sus hijos. Conoció el programa de la Fundación de los créditos a emprendedores y gusto mucho de la oportunidad de que la institución pudo brindarle.
 Tiene buena clientela y asegura que utilizará bien su crédito en la compra de mercaderías como bebidas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonarda S. has been a merchant for the last five years. She has a store in her home in Coronel Oviedo’s Virgen de Fátima neighborhood. She has been married to Mr. Pedro Vázquez for the last 21 years and they have five children: Nestor, 21, Pedro, 17, Fátima, 10, Rosio, 9, and Alexis, 10 months. Her business is very important because it’s the family’s main source of income. She comments that she started out with a small kiosk and gradually grew allowing her to benefit her children. She learned about the Fundación’s program of loans to entrepreneurs and liked the opportunity that the institution was able to offer her. She has a good customer base and assures us that she will use the loan well to buy more merchandise like beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages like: soft drinks, wines and beers.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
María del Socorro es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Pueblo Libre del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, ella cría pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio, alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona o de lo contrario vende su carne por kilos. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, comprando la carne de el pueblo de Tambogrande y vendiendola de manera ambulante en los diversos caseríos de la zona.

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que su aves se desarrollen de mejor modo para así poder obtener mas ingresos por sus ventas, para lograr esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una persona bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre está dispuestas a ayudar a los que la necesitan. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro is a mother, she is 32 years old, and she lives together with her husband and their children in the village of Pueblo Libre in the Tambogrande district. It is an agricultural region located in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. It is more than three hours and a half from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque. She raises and sells poultry, including turkeys and chickens. She raises them in the rear section of her house, feeding them grains and natural grasses. When they have achieved a certain stage in their development she sells them to the businesses in the region of she sells the meat by the kilogram. Her husband sells beef meat, pork meat and chicken meat. He purchases the meat in the village of Tambogrande and resells in the various villages in the area. Maria wishes to purchase balanced feed to help her poultry grow better and ultimately see better profits. To reach her goal she has decided to request a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. She is a very devoted mother and she is always ready to help anyone in need. Those that know her consider her to be a very calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchased balanced poultry feed.
